Reviews.Title: “Central Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, central Barcelona, lovely breakfast, pretty street with lots of small unique shops (beautiful chocolate shop on the corner). Beds a bit hard, the window didn't open, room smelt of cigarettes and room not cleaned until after 15.30, seemed very late especially if you want to come back to the room after being out for most of the day for a rest before going out in the evening . Friendly staff, lovely central courtyard, liked the idea of having afternoon tea available if you want it after a day out, especially if you have to wait while they cleaned the room!

Reviews.Title: “a little gem”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer97
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times now and would intend staying again when I return to Barcelona if a good deal was available. It is very close to the Ramblas but due to being on a quieter pedestrianised street is much more quiet at night allowing a good night's sleep. It is ideally situated to allow wandering through the myriad of narrow streets, where all sorts of hidden gems can be discovered. The breakfast is the clincher - make sure it is part of your deal as it will thoroughly set you up for the day. Failing that you can always pop back in and get complimentary tea and cake throughout the day.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: dyehouse
Reviews.Content: A great location easy and pleasant walking to the Ramblas the Port and the wonderful shopping areas. A very pleasant small hotel reception staff exceptional the drink on arrival is inspired marketing and should be a lesson to other hoteliers- breakfast a pleasure- rooms very clean. We slept well but obviously the volume of noise is as one should expect in such a central buzzing location. Would certainly stay there again just to enjoy taking wine in the nearby Pi Square. Thank you Michael and Sue

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing special, related to the price”
Reviews.Author: Janine1973
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a romantic 3 nights city trip, my husband and I. Considering the price, we found the hotel a bit small (we are very tall people, that's to say) and very noisy. One night we just woke up at 5 in the morning because our upper neighbours were packing their bags. It seemed like hours!! The alternative was to stay in the top of the hotel but the receptionist warned us that it could be very hot over there. Because of this, we decided to stay in our room and did not have any more complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Emma A
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room on line, when we arrived the desk staff were concerned that the room would be too small for two of us and offered an alternative. We stayed in the small room as were not planning on being there except to sleep. Great location, clean, friendly hotel. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a Great Area”
Reviews.Author: butty24
Reviews.Content: Recently back from a short break in Barcelona staying at this hotel. Really have to echo what everyone else says. This is a good hotel in a brilliant location right at the heart of things and excellent public transport connections. Yes the rooms are on the small side, but more than adequate as you won't be spending much time in them. The bathroom was a good size although the shower did have a mind of its own at times with temperature and pressure. The breakfast was typical European Hotel style with plenty of fresh choice to satisfy your needs. The hotel did lack a bar of an evening for a quick drink before going out, but there were plenty of options close by and a good selection of really good restaurants. As previous reviewers have said the staff at the hotel really are friendly and welcoming, always willing to help and give that welcoming advise. If we return to Barcelona then we will certainly choose this little hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “pre cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Wendy B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: taxi from bcn airport 30euros to hotel door good. brilliant position near bars shops and restaurants we were greeted on arrival with glass of champagne nice touch, afternoon tea/coffee water and cake all available for free, yet another nice touch. staff very helpfull,definatley includ breakfast we did and it was first class fruit, cerals,toast, fruit etc.we will go back and definatley recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: brokenseany70
Reviews.Content: Small friendly hotel just off la Ramblas. Very welcoming staff, excellent breakfast only down side is the noise from other rooms, walls must be very thin, and the fact that twin beds are on wheels and move if not careful. Warning - petit double it just that, not much larger than a single!!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice spot”
Reviews.Author: megsni
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend stayed here for three nights. It's a good thing we are good friends as the double bed was so tiny. It's technically a double room but I don't think it's normally used as that, as there was only one set of towels and one glass, etc in the room. It is a nice hotel though, just off Las Ramblas and we found it easily enough with the help of a man on the street pointing us in the right direction. The man on reception was very helpful with directions, even printed me a map. And there's a computer and printer in reception which is free and very helpful. On another note...dont be put off by the length of queues outsode of La Sagrada Familia...the inside is a do not miss!

Reviews.Title: “"A hidden little gem"”
Reviews.Author: Debbie W
Reviews.Content: Arrived back from a 3night 8-2-12 to 11-2-2012. On arrival the lady on reception was most welcoming and offered us a glass of cava which was most welcoming after our flight and train journey. The room was on the top floor on the side and was very clean, spacious and nicely decorated. Everything about ouir stay was excellent, room serviced daily, staff very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was excellent- great variety and all you can eat which was great as we didn't need to buy lunch as we were still full. I would recomend this hotel and would most definately stay here agan.

Reviews.Title: “short break to barcelona”
Reviews.Author: grooviechique
Reviews.Content: just back from 4 nights in barcelona what a great city. stayed in the H10 raco del pi hotel, very central, clean,quiet and overall very good hotel. Staff are very helpful and friendly. this is the second tine we have stayed in this hotel and i would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in Gothic Area of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: MartinSW
Reviews.Content: Needing a hotel for just one night in a central position, Hotel Raco Del Pi meets these requirements very well, being close to both Placa Catalunya and the cathedral. It is not large but is clean and very comfortable with friendly and helpful staff - it would also be suitable for longer stays; we will certainy use it on another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: funkylittlefrog
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel. Very warm and friendly staff. Welcome glass of cava on arrival. Beautiful clean room with a small balcony overlooking a back-street just off Las Ramblas. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality and value in great location”
Reviews.Author: dominorat
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights and had very enjoyable time. Took the RENFE train from the airport to passage de gracia station, then metro to Liceu which is only about 5 mins walk from the hotel. This is probably the cheapest way to arrive from the airport but not the quickest! As per other reviews we found the staff to be very helpful and welcoming. Our room was on the top floor in a corner location: these room have the double sinks and seem to be a bit larger: but the down side of this room was that the only windows were skylights, fixed closed and with opaque glass, and a low level small window about the size and position of a radiator.The room was therefore hot, stuffy and claustrophobic. Our airconditioning did however (thankfully), work. The room was spotlessly clean, and only problem was the shower that went on a cycle of very hot, freezing cold and for a short time just right! We did ask if anything could be done about it....but apparently not. Breakfast is very nice: cooked and cold buffet. Look out for B&B deals when booking. A safe is avaiable, and also luggage can be left secure if needed. All these things makes the stay easier. The location is very enjoyable: near Las Ramblas, the metro, numerous eateries, and within walking distance of the port. Generally we felt safe, however don't be lulled into a false sense of security....one guest had all valuables taken from his rucksack whilst out and about. We had an attempted mugging/pick pocketing in the street outside the hotel, but managed to foil the attempt. All in all I would consider returning to the hotel and think the staff should be proud of the service they supply.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: miss_imperfect
Reviews.Content: we were greeted by a glass of prosecco and nuts upon check-in as a welcome drink and it was very welcoming indeed, after a long flight and travel to the hotel! the room was pleasant and modern, lovely pillows and full bathroom amenities. there was enough space for both our huge backpacks, and free wifi! the hotel also had a public computer for all to use, and the staff were friendly and spoke good english, and were always ready to help you! the room heater was really powerful, but as we were both afraid of heat and the aircon didn't work due to winter, we had to sleep with the windows open as it was pretty stuffy, and we were worried that someone might climb in from the roof next building as our window overlooked a small alley behind the hotel and the roof was quite nearby. however, all was fine and we were safe! at the end of the street there was cafes, restaurants and a bar, and along the next street from there there were also bars and tapas from as low as 3euros each.. the hotel was close to Liceu metro, and in the heart of the shopping area, which made it easy for us to drop our shoping bags back in the room before heading out for a late dinner or drinks! from the airport take the aerobus (EUR10.60 for 2 people) to plaza de catalunya. when you get off the bus, you will see across the road, a very large shopping street with many shops (desigual, h&m, zara etc) and alot of people! cross the road and head on into the street, walk all the way in while keeping right, till the end you will see on your diagonal-right, small lane that says 'carrer del pi', and the hotel is right on that lane :) p.s. it's barcelona, do take good care of your belongings and shopping, and beware of pickpockets! we would definitely recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Georg R
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a very satisfying 4 nights at Raco Del Pi. The room was not too tiny, comfy bed, good window view, roomy bathroom with excellent towels. Staff were incredibly friendly and accommodating, both while we were staying there and even before we were officially guests. We arrived unexpectedly around 5:30am by bus from Arles, France, and went to the hotel since nothing else was open yet in Barcelona. The evening staff let us leave our bags, made us coffee, and let us rest up a bit before spending our first day in the city. Hotel location is excellent - in the middle of the Barrio Gotic, very close to the cathedral, Las Ramblas, and the Boquerita market. We hope to stay here again on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for touring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: SunSeaker01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the H10 the first week in November 2011. We were touring Barcelona for 5 days and wanted to stay in the gothic district in the heart of the city. What a cool little spot. The rooms and hotel are quite small by North American standards, but the place was clean, the staff went out of their way to be friendly and helpful, the beds were comfortable, and the location was fantastic. The rooms were very modern. We had a balcony overlooking the street below, which was very picturesque. We ate breakfast at the hotel most mornings, I thought for about $8 CAN/pp it was a pretty good value. It was a short walk to the subway, which made it a snap to get to the train station. I went out running at 6 in the morning most days, and it was a nice 10k down las rambles to the ocean and along the old ocean out to the old olympic village (which is now the very expensive and delux hotel arts, stayed there years ago and it is otherworldlyinuit about 5x the cost of the H10). Never felt unsafe, close to everything (I love to walk). If you are looking for something like the Penninsula this is not the place you want. If you are looking for modern, clean, affordable ($125/night CAN) well located base for visiting Barcelona, this might be the a great spot for you too. If I ever get back there, I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. Really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Threeeee
Reviews.Content: Our check in started with the host at the reception desk correcting the pronunciation of our last name. The a/c did not work and we were told there was nothing that could be done about it. The over night host was helpful in finding food and local art galleries. Over all not a great experience for our first night in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: stevetracey
Reviews.Content: Very good location for all sights and metro. Very friendly staff, room was a little small but clean. Breakfast choice was good - no restaurant but Sinatras just off the square is a two minute walk and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location offering good value for money”
Reviews.Author: h0lidayg0lightly
Reviews.Content: I and my two teenage children stayed here for two nights. The hotel is right in the middle of the old part of Barcelona and within easy walking distance of Las Ramblas and other attractions with lots of great cafes just around the corner, providing good value breakfasts and suppers. Our rooms were on the small side but very clean. The two of us who were sharing upgraded to a larger room which was more spacious and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We were greeted with a glass of something cold and fizzy which was a nice touch. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean.”
Reviews.Author: greekgod1
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 2 day midweek stay in Barcelona and would definitely return to this hotel. Very close to all the popular sites but not noisey or too busy. The rooms are clean and tidy balcony rooms give you a taste of authentic Spanish life. As with precious reviews all the staff are helpful and the Cava on arrival is a nice touch. The only thing missing was tea/coffee facilities in the room for a morning drink but they are available for free from 2pm in the bar area, overall you can't go wrong with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good hotel, value for your money, location great!”
Reviews.Author: NiinaE
Reviews.Content: I think Raco del Pi was an excellent choice. Location couldn´t be better. The Gothic Part, Las Ramblas, Placa Catalunya - you could walk everywhere. I felt very safe walking even at night time. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They recommended good restaurants. Avoid Las Ramblas area for dining, the food is not good and very expensive. I recommend highly walk a little away from Ramblas and try restaurants. Menu el dia is a good and usually quite inexpensive everytyhing included even desserts. The rooms in this hotel were quite small and our AC did not work but it was not needed as the weather wasn´t hot but only pleasant just a few weeks from christmas. We stayed three night and paid approximately 320€. The breakfast was included and a welcoming drink and a bottle of cava and chocolates in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely little hotel in a great part of town”
Reviews.Author: LanaBeck317
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little gem in the Gothic part of the old city. It's tucked away on a little street near the main cathedral, within very easy reach of the Ramblas and Placa de Catalunya. From the moment we arrived, the staff could not have been more helpful or lovely. There was a glass of champagne each as we checked in and we were advised to take a twin room rather than the double we'd originally requested, as it had more space and meant we could have a balcony. They even recommended a place for good tapas late at night. The room was lovely (the beds easily pushed together if that's your preference) with a clean bathroom with tub and shower, plenty of wardrobe and floor space and a sweet little balcony that overlooked part of the cathedral. It's worth saying that when the back streets come to life in the morning, it can be a bit noisy, but to be honest that's part of the buzz of being somewhere like Barcelona. Once again, on the day we left, the staff were so helpful. They looked after our luggage as we had one last stroll around the city, called us a cab and then came to find us from the coffee bar when the driver had arrived. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again, as it's reasonably priced, in a great location, comfortable and full of friendly staff, which I think makes such a difference.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: ohlnielsen
Reviews.Content: Perfect within the old city, close to everything. Staff helpful and forthcoming. Very spacious room and bath, good bed, everything works well, breakfast was offered special at €8 at which the quality was acceptable. Some (but not unacceptable) noise from other guests, hallway, elevator and streets - noise reduction could be improved. I would book it again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Find For First Timers To Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Jazmincleo
Reviews.Content: I simply can't fault this hotel. It's more of a city boutique hotel for couples than a family type residence over run with kids. Visited here with another couple, none of us had ever visited Barcelona and so it was an excellent find for the four of us. We were very impressed. I have many reviews on here and so if I am impressed then it's good. I am not always impressed. First impressions were of a stylish hotel with pleasant staff. Complimentary glass of cava each on an evening at reception and staff who were happy to help with any enquiry. Rooms were clean and tidy with blackout curtains, LCD flat screen with Sky News, complimentary WIFI, mini bar, music player and hair dryer. Champagne glasses were a nice touch, much nicer than a bog standard tumbler glass. Toiletries were extensive and changed every day with soap, shower gel, body cream, toothbrush, tissues, razor, shoe horn, comb, sewing kit and shoe shine. I've never stayed in a hotel with such a complimentary selection. If you'd forgotton something on arrival there was no shortage of alternatives, It's these touches that make a stay in a hotel a little more nicer. The room was immaculately clean, the communal areas were light and airy, the rooms come with air con as standard. I simply can't fault it and tucked away in the pedestrian area behind the catherdral, just off the main street made it a perfect location for anyone sightseeing Barcelona. There are many excellent bars nearby especially "My Bar" behind McDonalds and KFC on La Rambla which is about a 2 minute walk from the hotel. It has all of the home beers you'd expect from an English/Irish bar and was a daily regular haunt of ours.

Reviews.Title: “charming”
Reviews.Author: juice-trip
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I was a bit afraid that our room would be extreme small. It wasn't. It was no ballroom but their was space enough for all our luggage and the room itself had everything we needed. Nice bed, perfect bathroom, a window that we could open with a view on the little hotel patio. The atmosphere was very cozy, the people at reception wonderful. Okay, we arrived on a sunday and missed our free glass of cava... But so what. Breakfast in the hotel was okay: different cheeses, meats, eggs any way you want them. We had a deal for 8 euro each, but after one day we decided to go out to the beautiful little square just around the corner. And their are more little and not expensive breakfastplaces in the neigbourhoud. In the small streets around the hotel there are also plenty of options to relax with a nice glass and to enjoy good Spanisch cuisine and tapa's. We enjoyed the tapas on the terrace of Bar del Pi very much. The cathedral is just a couple of minutes away as is the 'hip' Born-area with lot of eating/drinking options and of course the Picasso Museum.. So: location, location, location. Also the Ramblas is just around the corner, but you don't have the hassle of it. All in all, we had a wonderful stay at Raco del Pi. It will be the place for us if we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Bad deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: E K
Reviews.Content: We didn't have hot water for 24 hours. I called the front desk several times, they said it would be on in a few minutes-- nope. The man at the front desk claimed all the other rooms had hot water, but said I couldn't get another room or a discount for our cold-water room until the manager came in the next morning at 10 (we were checking out at 8). We got a minimal discount at checkout, from the only staffer who had been at all helpful during our five-night stay. The location is great, but the room was shabby, badly in need of painting and redecorating, and the service was nonexistent to terrible, especially for a hotel in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were fantastic, lovley hotel will go back next year”
Reviews.Author: sammy_nicks
Reviews.Content: Staff were brilliant, I had booked one of the smaller rooms in the hotel and was offered an upgrade for €10 per night,(was worth it) and was lovley had two balconies over looking the street, was a bit noisy at night but all a part of the hussel and bussel of a major city, was a bit pricey but you are also paying for the location which was fantastic just off les rambles, I came with a friend and his daughter who have both stayed here before and recommended it to me, my only thing was the shower would go hot and cold every so often but, I really enjoyed my stay here and thanks to Ruban very nice gentleman who worked in reception, see you all next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: NiceforthePrice
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay in Barcelona and the hotel is in a fantastic location. It is a cosy little 3 star hotel. The staff were very friendly, complimentary coffee and tea with croissants in the afternoon are a nice touch and the rooms are nice. To be completely honest the location makes the hotel as there are things that could be better with the rooms for the price. This is not a cheap 3star hotel and we felt that is does not represent value for money. Lots of little places nearby to eat: Taller de Tapas, Bar del Pi and also La Pineda is a fantastic little authentic deli you can sit and have a glass of wine or eat in.... We had a room on the street with balconies but the noise from the street kept us awake. A nice little place but would stay somewhere different next time

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: moxieandgiggi
Reviews.Content: comfortable little hotel with an accomodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: Ja V
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before a cruise. The staff was knowledgeable, competent, helpful, and friendly, there is nothing they could have done to make our stay better. They let us check in early and we got a beautiful room with two little balconies (rm 204). We had a view of Santa Maria del Pi from one balcony. The room was compact but well laid out and clean. The bathroom was clean and nice with a deep tub. The breakfast was compact but great, and contained everything we could want, eggs, pastries, fresh fruit, etc. The WiFi in the room worked well. But the best feature of this hotel is its location! In the middle of the Gothic quarter, steps from everything on a quiet narrow street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, easy parking, near metro & La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: doctorGo
Reviews.Content: My husband & I self parked our rental car in an underground "Saba" garage near the Goya Museum which is a 5 minute walk to the hotel (thanks to the pedestrian mode on our Garmin). The hotel has discounted parking passes which we bought for $26 US dollars CASH per day. Once here we could easily walk to most attractions. The metro is also about 5 minutes away where we bought an 8 euro "shared" ticket good for 10 rides (5 per couple). This location is fabulous! Our room is average, but spotless. Also we have FREE wi-fi and can get CNN on TV. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay and a wonderful place to be”
Reviews.Author: adkresolve
Reviews.Content: We were at the Hotel H10 Raco Del Pi for five days the last week of September 2011. It is within walking distance of nearly everything one wants to do, and or within proximity to public transport if required. You are also within walking distance of most tour meeting locations. The staff was helpful and responsive. The room (308) was in the back with a windowed balcony and well appointed.....it did over look an alley......but was reasonably large and the bath was large and more than sufficient, but it is location, location, location that makes the Hotel. The building is an adaptive reuse and the prior reviews seem to depend on the luck of the draw with regard to rooms, but our experience was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Trying hard ... but don't be fooled by the website”
Reviews.Author: Simon J
Reviews.Content: This is an average 3* hotel in an exceptional city where you get what you pay for. The website's really well done and it looks like a total bargain. It's not. Get a courtyard room for a quiet night with the windows open - if your room has a window, some on the 4th have skylights only. That said, it's staggering distance from La Ramblas, so if you're after overpriced tapas and tourist tat, it's paradise. Also very convenient for the Metro. One tip, if you search the hotel on Google Maps, the locator is a couple of streets off - on a very dodgy, smelly back alley.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Thess
Reviews.Content: We needed a place for only one night, before leaving on a Med Cruise. Booked this hotel by chance, but am so glad we did! Right in the centre of the Gothic Quarters, the taxi had some problems finding it, but he did at last! Walking distance to everything!!! Friendly and helpful staff! Our room was a bit small, but I had only booked a regular one since it was just for one night. Breakfast was good. A smallish buffet, but still good! I wish I had booked it for the two nights after our cruise too... But that's a different review! We'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly pleased with a few caveats”
Reviews.Author: Peggy593
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple stayed there for three nights following a cruise. The location was fabulous, and the staff was very helpful. We especially liked the young lady who worked during the day (I'm sorry I can't remember her name.) We were lucky enough to be in Barcelona for the Festa de La Merce, the city's major festival for their patron saint. However, this made the room quite expensive, even booking it six months in advance. We had a standard double room, which was smallish, but fine for two people. (Don't go to Europe expecting big hotel rooms.) We were one floor up, on the street side, which was quite noisy, especially Saturday night during the Festival. Breakfast was expensive so we ventured out to cafes, which were great (although they don't seem to open before 8am). Internet was free and was fast and good. There's even a printer at the hotel computer so you can print boarding passes. The welcome glass of cava was delightful, and they have free coffee out after noon. It's a great location, close to the Cathedral with plenty of places to eat and shop around. The one thing that really irritated me was when we checked out early to get to the airport, we asked for a cup of coffee before the cab arrived, and were told we had to pay for it. I thought at 250 euros a night, the least we could get was one cup of coffee in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel at great location”
Reviews.Author: WilQ
Reviews.Content: Location is the best of the hotel. You walk out of the hotel and be right in the middle-age. Service is also great. Staffs are willing to help. Room is a little bit old but still good and clean enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: happytravels87_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my partner and we thought the hotel was good for the price. It's in a fantastic location, just off la rambla so it's very easy to get anywhere you want to go to. It's also very close to two metro stations. The rooms aren't fantastic but they are clean and comfortable and the bathrooms are nice and look like they've recently been refurbished. You also get a glass of champagne and some nibbles on arrival which is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: julia m
Reviews.Content: In the middle of the hustle and bustle of Barcelona, and yet our room was quiet. Room was small but fresh and tidy. Unexpectedly pleased by the array of options for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location (and more)”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideAndrew
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this boutique hotel in the heart of Barcelona's Gothic Quarter, where we stayed for three nights, prior to joining a cruise. Guests are greeted with a glass of local cava (the only hotel that had such a welcome in our six week tour of Europe). Plenty of tapas bars nearby and the hop on, hop off bus has a stop for the Quarter, just walking distance away. Other than taxis (our taxi dropped us off at the door) and police, it didn't seem like any vehicles were allowed in the Quarter, which made for a peaceful stay. The room was modern, well appointed and very clean with good airconditioning. Our room had a balcony overlooking the street, which added to our enjoyment. Wifi is free, but access can be difficult from rooms, although a terminal is also available in the common area. Free coffee and tea is provided 24 hours a day for guests to help themselves. Breakfast was an extra and limited to what the chef cooked - no personal egg requests, but included juice and cereals, and fried or scrambled eggs and bacon. A great hotel and we wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, friendly staff, lovely room!”
Reviews.Author: Wendy O
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before boarding a cruise ship. The location can't be beat for a quick tour of Barcelona. It puts you right in the middle of the gothic quarter and Las Ramblas. The rooms were lovely and clean. We were fortunate to have a little balcony looking out on the street, which was a nice surprise. We received complimentary glasses of cava upon checking in, which was another nice surprise and is always welcome after a long and arduous airplane journey. I kept trying cava at restaurants, but I actually liked the hotel's variety best. The hotel is on a very small and winding street that most cars and cabs don't drive on. Print out a detailed map before you go, or buy a data plan for your cellphone so you can rely on google maps. Our cab dropped us off close by and then pointed in the hotel's general direction, so be prepared for that when staying in the gothic quarter.

Reviews.Title: “we will return”
Reviews.Author: TonyL773
Reviews.Content: Do not believe the reviews about this hotel it was excellent the staff were very helpful The room had everything you could ask for The breakfast was great The location was spot-on Overall we had a very pleasant stay I would recommend this hotel to my friends and have done so

Reviews.Title: “just right”
Reviews.Author: travelmom004
Reviews.Content: Delighted with my hotel choice, especially after spending so much time on this site, reading and comparing notes. Actually writing on their (free) computer, stationed in the back lobby, in the wee hours of the morning (I have not adjusted to the change in time) and it is much too early for breakfast (we are paying an extra charge) and therefore the buffet will not be reviewed at this time. So far--the hotel is in a great location (pedestrian area, center of the old city) and yet the room is quiet. Several first impressions--an intimate hotel with cool and stylish decor, extremely nice, helpful staff, and we especially enjoyed being greeted with a glass of bubbly cava--and you can also enjoy free coffee or tea througout the day. We were given a wonderful double room, spacious and clean, with a modern bathroom, but I know not all rooms are created equal, bed-wise, size-wise or otherwise. Perhaps we will have other experiences later in our stay, but so far, it feels just right--and it is a perfect place to enjoy a fabulous city. .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, mediocre rooms, they don't honor reservations.”
Reviews.Author: shiraz14
Reviews.Content: First let me say the El Gotic region is the place to be for the most bars and restaurants in walking distance. This hotel is in a great location. The room at the hotel was average/small. The shower was literally half a tub, tightly fitted between the toilet and bidet, which made it a bit tricky to get in and out of-and I'm young and athletic. I would have loved to have a balcony... I asked everyday for a balcony, and worked around their random schedules to able them to tap into their computer system to reserve one i.e. 4:40am. I was told then to come back at 12pm after the occupied room's checkout for a balcony. Of course, I return at 12 to be disappointed. The front desk was disorganized and unprofessional since my reservation for the balcony was not honored. It was a waste of my time. Furthermore, I heard this is normal at the H10 hotel from the front desk manager. That many people do not get the rooms they reserved and get turned away at the desk. Which defeats the purpose of a reservation. I rather have not gotten a room and gotten a refund because I stayed down the street at Grand Central Hotel for the latter half of my vacation and it was so much nicer, bigger, with a stunning rooftop pool overlooking the city. I would not recommend this hotel for my business colleagues or really anyone for that matter when I realized how many nicer hotels there are in the same area- that I'm sure can afford to provide a balcony for at least one day of the trip during a two week stay, especially when reserved non-the-less. Most of the highly starred reviews on this hotel had a balcony, it really makes or breaks a trip especially when you are crammed in a tiny room it provides a separate area. So I guess you can try your luck and you might have a different impression. Needless to say I wasn't satisfied with the hotels performance other than the maid service which was fantastic. Also just a fyi- the beds are hard and two people is a full size, there is no alarm clock, no ipod dock, no full size mirror, and the blow dryer barely works. Expect mediocre conditions, don't expect your reservations to be honored.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't get over the location”
Reviews.Author: reeby83
Reviews.Content: i had been to barcelona before and had spent time in the gothic quarter. when i booked this hotel, i knew it was in the gothic quarter but nothing prepared me for how amazing the location of this hotel was. my husband and i stopped for 1 night after driving from montpellier part of a road trip around france and spain. we found an underground car park where we could park for 24hrs and walked to the hotel with our bags. we were exhausted when we got to the hotel, the two guys on reception were lovely, supplying us with a glass of cava each and even topping up our glasses. just the welcome we needed. then they suggested we upgrade to a larger room with a balcony as the one I had booked was apparently very very small. it was worth the extra 20euros. the view from our room was amazing, a typical barcelona narrow street, gorgeous building at the top which we could see from our balcony and the amazing cathedral was just 1 minute away. we took showers and went straight out,m walking around and just soaking up beautiful barcelona. paella on las ramblas, walked down to the marina, then back up towards our hotel through narrow windy streets. late at night managed to get a table at a very busy tapas bar outside where we enjoyed a bottle of rioja and a few nibbles. we will be booking to go back to barcelona again and again and will deinately stay at the raco del pi.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel at an affordable rate!”
Reviews.Author: Terri, Colorado Springs
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a pre-cruise day based on other reviewers from TripAdvisor and was very pleased. Just remember the hotel rooms in Europe are smaller when you book the standard rooms, if you book a higher category room they are quite spacious. We had one normal room in our group and one with a secondary bed for a third guest, that room was huge by European standards! I would definately recommend this hotel, skip the morning pricy breakfast and go find a nice little bakery!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: hachii
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at H10 Raco Del Pi. The location is fantastic - right in the heart of the beautiful Gothic Quarter. There are plenty of sights and shopping near by. The staff spoke really good English, and were really friendly. The room was modern and very clean, with good air conditioning. My room only had a very small window, but it was a single room, and there is so much to see right outside the front door, that the lack of view didn't matter. There is Wifi and a good lift in the hotel. And there were apples for guests to take at reception every morning! There is a small restaurant in the hotel, but I did not eat there. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel in old interesting neighborhood close to La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: ellentravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights in August and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. It was a bit difficult to find in the winding old lanes, but the front desk welcomed with warmly with perfect English. Our room had a small balcony overlooking a quiet street, a comfortable bed, large bathroom and good size. Breakfast was excellent and attractively served: eggs, pastries, cheeses, fresh fruit and good coffee. Great location within 5 min walk to La Rambla, La Musica Palau ( concert hall), cathedral and hop on/hop off bus. Pretty little streets to explore. Clean and restful. i heartily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel... Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Hoodlum_the_CD
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect hotel for our trip to Barcelona, the first stop in our tour of Spain. I was traveling with my wife and three children (aged 10, 12, and 14) and our family friends, a couple with two children (aged 12 and 14). When I travel for work I typically stay in Marriott's, JW Marriott's, Hilton's, Intercontinentals, etc. While the rooms here are predictably smaller given the historic location, I would take this hotel over any of those chains. I would not have traded it for the W or any of the luxury high-rise hotels in Barcelona. The hotel was a 27 Euro cab ride from the airport. We noticed that some cab drivers did not realize you could drive down what look like pedestrian streets to drop you off... so you need to let them know it is ok to do so. It is located right off Las Ramblas in the Barri Gottic. There are plenty of tourists around, as there always are when an area is visually interesting, but do not let that stop you. There are lots of interesting shops (not just tourist shops) and restaurants within walking distance. We spent a great deal of time just hanging out at the Bar del Pi just down the street. I do not honestly see how anyone could complain abou this hotel. The lobby and common areas are very well maintained, the staff was enormously friendly and all spoke perfect English, and the rooms were clean and well appointed. There was an incredible little courtyard area for which pictures cannot do justice, and we spent afternoons there drinking the coffee or cava that the hotel offered with their compliments every day. The hotel is about a mile from the Beach, and it is worth a walk even if you don't go in the water. We did go in the water, but if you really want to go to the beach, do yourself a favor and take the forty-minute train to Sitges... we did, and it was gorgeous... an amazing day trip. The hotel is also very close to the Cathedral. We took in a flea market set up near the Cathedral one day, and any antique fan would have enjoyed the quality and prices of the items offered. Same goes for the antique shops near the hotel. The hotel is not especially close to the Sagrada Familia, but it is not so far that you cannot walk. We walked up Las Ramblas to the upper Ramblas and took a quick right turn to check it out. The area was very safe, and we felt 100% comfortable walking with our children even very late at night (after Midnight). Never once in Barcelona did I ever feel the threat of a pick-pocket or even hear about someone else having any trouble. The warnings we read about on the forums were, in our estimation, VERY exagerated. They reminded me of when we go out to dinner in Atlanta with some of our suburban friends, and they lock the doors whenever they see a homeless person. Paranoia does not make for a relaxing vacation. Anyone who is comfortable in a US city will be even more so in Barcelona. I felt safer or as safe in Barcelona than I do in any major US city... and I travel often for work to downtown areas. Both my wife and the other woman who we were with felt the same. I was back to carrying my wallet in my pocket after the first day, and I was embarressed that I had worried about it to begin with... sort of the way I felt when I showed up with bear bells in Montana. Book this hotel. It is fantastic, and it is the perfect location to explore this awesome city!

Reviews.Title: “very good choice”
Reviews.Author: 55pinchy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on recommendations I'd read on trip advisor.I booked three rooms months in advance .We were travelling with my parents, sister and her husband.Two of the rooms were very good but my sister's room was terrible.I found out (from the reception) that they descibe it as a petite double room,but the bed was barely a single bed size, and it filled the entire room.I had to put some of their luggage in my room.I was told that they were completely full and unable to offer them another room.The disappointing thing is that they were charged the same room rate as my (and my parents) rate which wasnt fair. I felt seeing as I had booked and paid for the room well in advance,we should have been given the better room and saved the "petite room" for latecomers. Apart from that the hotel was in a great spot and the breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Great location”
Reviews.Author: TrueToTravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at this hotel. It was in a great location on a pedestrian street. The room was very clean, both the bathroom and bedroom area were cleaned well on a daily basis. The room was bright, modern and updated. The staff was helpful and answered all of our questions. They all spoke english very well. There was also one computer with free internet, which we never had to wait as we often checked our email at the end of our day. We also had breakfast each morning which was very good. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe what you see on the website”
Reviews.Author: Janice0333
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and thought this would be a good choice. Sadly I was really wrong. We arrived around 8pm and were given a tiny holle of a room with one little window at floor level! I asked to change and was told there was nothing else as we'd checked in late. I reserved this hotel 3 months before our trip! I could not believe that a better room had not been set aside. I was told to go back to the front desk the next day around noon and they would give us a room with a window. Room still tiny, window so-so. When I asked at the front desk if I could pay for an upgrade to get a room with a balcony as shown on the internet or whether they could move me to another hotel within the H10 chain that would have more air circulation in the room, I was abusively talked to by the guy at the front desk. He brought me to tears and I walked away. Some stay... Aside from these issues, it was the only hotel i have ever stayed in while on vacation in Europe that could not ... would not accommodate our bikes! Not worth the location, especially considering the ridiculously high price!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leejan
Reviews.Content: June 7th - 10th We have visited Barcelona on 3 occasions and on each occasion we have stayed at this hotel. I agree it is a little expensive and the breakfast is way to much expensive, but the friendly staff the fantastic rooms and the location is worth the money. Barcelona is a vibrant city but the Gothic Qtr is the place to be, you are in a place were you have history mixed with great bars and restaurants. We will be back and it will be the same hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Excellent Location in Barri Gotic”
Reviews.Author: ZzzzTravelMan
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Room was very clean and in a great location. Could get noisy but with the windows closed it was fine. Would certainly stay there again. Room 104 has 2 windows, one with a tiny terrace on the street and the other to an alley. Right over fron entrance. Had free computer and internet, breakfast (additional charge) but GREAT staff - very helpful. Bed was a little hard. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of things”
Reviews.Author: HollyGolightly60
Reviews.Content: As a solo female traveller location was of high importance to me, I wanted to be close to restaurants so that i didnt have to walk a long way back to my hotel late at night. The location was very central to the gothic quarter, just round the corner from the church, where i went to a Spanish guitar concert, close to the Cathedral Eualalia and all the wonderful little shops and boutiques. My room was a 'petite double' which was perfect for one person. There wasnt any external noise to worry about but you could hear the odd door banging and the sound of flushing from the room above, but nothing to worry about. Breakfast was the usual, something for everyone, fruit, cereal, yoghurt, croissants, rolls, cheeses, meats, eggs, toast etc etc. There was complimentary self service coffee and cake during the day if you wanted it, I used to pop back for a cuppa in the afternoon as the hotel was so central it wasnt out of the way at all. I would've liked a cocktail or nightcap when returning at night but the bar closed at 8.30 p.m. although the mini-bar was well stocked, but I like to chat to other guests in a hotel bar when you're travelling solo. There is nothing else negative i can find to say about this hotel. I cant understand the bad review from the guy back in March. All staff that i came across were friendly and courteous to me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: angiebabe67
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the end of April with my husband, having been to Barcelona before we knew the area we wanted to stay and after a bit of research on TA found this hotel. As previously stated, it is in a fantastic location, in the middle of the gothic quater, and was very easy to find. We got the aerobus from the airport, which drops you off in placa catalunya, and was a very straightforward walk down to the hotel, taking approx 10-15 mins. I would definitely recommned using the bus, costing only 5 euro's each way (we could have got a return, but wanted to see how easy the hotel was to find from the bus stop - it was very easy). At the hotel, we were checked in by a friendly chap and offered a complimentary glass of cold cava and nibbles. The room wasn't the best - we should have asked for another, but didn't - it looked out onto a narrow alley and the large window/door seemed to be fixed closed - possibly health and safety?? It was a fairly small room, but was clean and functional. The bathroom was clean and well lit, the shower screen was rather on the small side, so water tended to be all over the floor after using - but wasn't really a major problem. No drink making facilities in the room, (there was minibar) but complimentary tea and coffee and cakes and pastries down near the breakfast room - which we did use on a couple of occasions and was very welcome after a day out sightseeing. Breakfast itself was the standard continental offering, a reasonable choice and certainly enough to keep us going for a good few hours! Overall we were very happy with the hotel and price and I would stay here again, but would ask for a better front facing room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bellOxford Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a nice friendly hotel, in a very handy location parallel to Las Ramblas so in a quieter area ,the room was large and clean and breakfast was great, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Untrustworthy hotel staff almost ruined Barcelona for us.”
Reviews.Author: CrystalRenee
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work, nationally and internationally, and this was easily my worst experience at a hotel. So much so that I'm writing my first Tripadvisor review, because I love this site and use the reviews, and had used the reviews of this hotel to determine it was a great place to stay. It was awful on so many levels. We arrived in Barcelona early on a night train from Paris. We had just been engaged in Paris and were ecstatic to see Barcelona. We were at the hotel by 10am, and the front desk manager rudely told us our room wasn't ready and we could come back later. We asked for a time to return and he said "I don't know." We came back around 1pm and were told that our room was still not ready, but that we had really booked the wrong room because it was for students and was 2 beds. We knew that we had booked a standard bed, but we went ahead and agreed to upgrade to the room they recommended simply because they said they were unsure when our small would be ready. When we tried to pay for the room, we were told that we couldn't pay by credit card because it was less than 60 Euro and no one in Barcelona will accept credit card when it is less than 40 Euro. We had just arrived, so we believed him and paid cash, but asked for a receipt. He then asked if we'd like to rent a safe in our room for an additional 2 Euro per day. When we declined he said "Really? Ok..." It was the strangest response for the front desk manager to encourage to lock up your belongings in your room. We felt like he was going to steal from us himself after this conversation. When we asked for a tapas restaurant recommendation, the front desk manager pulled out a handful of flyers to insist we get pizza instead. In Barcelona.He would call and we would get a free shot (and he would get a nice kickback I'm sure). He said there were no tapas places close. We walked half a block to Plaza Del Pi and found two great tapas bars. We asked the hotel to call us a cab one night after a terrible experience in a cab from the train station (he basically drove us in circles pretending not to speak English. The cab driver was talking to the front desk when we came downstairs 5 minutes before the time we called the cab for. When we jumped in the cab, the cab driver set the rate at 8 Euro for his wait. We argued with him, and he finally agreed to take it down to 5 Euro for the wait. It should have been reset to 0. When we returned from dinner, we reported the cab driver to the hotel and asked if they would call for us to report the driver. He gave us a card and said we could try but they didn't speak English. Last, the hotel room itself was tiny and the bed and sheets were terrible. Hard, cheap, awful. And the room itself was painfully hot. We woek up at 2am and went downstairs to request a fan and report a problem with the thermostat, but of course, they couldn't help. Do NOT stay at this hotel. The area is great though if you can find something else!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Barcelona Experience”
Reviews.Author: Travelgal999
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the BEST location, right in the heart of the Gothic distict. It is a safe and convenient area. Our room was large with tall ceilings and a large bathroom. The room was decorated well, had big closets, a great shower and we could adjust the air conditioning ourselves. I thought it was large by European standards. The beds were ok, but after walking all day in Barcelona, there were just find for a restful night. The room had blackout curtains to block out the lights and noises of the city. It was very quiet at night. Occasionally, early in the morning, we heard some trucks and deliveries, but it was really not that bad. (If you are sensitive to noise, simply using some earplugs in the morning would have blocked out any sounds I head. I never travel without them!) There was a restaurant at the hotel, but we usually went to one of the local cafes on the many squares that are seconds from the hotel. Each day, we walked out of the hotel and into the heart of the city. We were very close to Barcelona Cathedral and there were nightly shows in the square next to it. We could walk everywhere! The hotel is close to Las Ramblas and El Raval, but no so close that you have to deal with any of the loud crazyness of of those areas. We were also able to walk to the beach, and to metro stations. Ideal location! The staff spoke English, which was helpful my Spanish stinks, and everyone was very professional, couteous, and helpful. We were given help with directions and given wonderful recommendations for restaurants. We felt safe and comfortable at Raco del Pi. It was a great place to come home to after long days of sightseeing. Word of caution: The only drawback to Barcelona is pickpockets. They are not violent, but they are looking for people that are not paying attention. ( Ladies, bring a purse that zips and wear it close to your body. Men, keeping your cell phone or wallet in your back pocket is just asking for it!) We were not pickpockets, but we were smart about things. As long as you pay attention to your belongings, you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ankey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little gem in the middle of the gothic quarter. The staff were very friendly, the rooms spotless and the breakfast was perfect. We arrived at the hotel early and our room was ready, we were greeted with a lovely glass of cava (even at 11 in the morning). Our room was at the back of the hotel so very quiet and had everything we needed. Lots of towels and toilettries, mini bar, safe and flat screen TV. Breakfast was a great selection of breads, fruits, juices, yoghurts, meat and cheese aswell as hotel eggs and bacon. Free Wifi and free internet facilities to print boarding cards etc. I would def book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the Gothic Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Crazytravelgirl
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on Tripadvisor and was drawn to the price and the location. I was traveling with my husband, some family and their friends who had never been to Barcelona before. Having been there before I knew I wanted to stay in the Gothic Quarter and this hotel perfectly located on a quaint street with quick access to La Rambla. The hotel itself is small but pretty. The rooms were small but comfortable. I wish there were better blankets because I got a bit cold. The staff were great and my husband and I enjoyed chatting with them and they were always willing to help. There was free internet which was a bit slow on their computer. The website listed a free snack bar which I was a bit confused about because my dad was charged at one point for taking a coffee. There is a restaurant for breakfast but for 16 euro we just went on La Rambla and found breakfast for under 6 euro. We enjoyed using the courtyard to have some of our meals of local breads, cured meats and wine. One night we started a little party there with some of the other guests. Warning about La Rambla: On our first night my husband was nearly pickpocked. One morning my father went for a Starbucks run and harassed by working girls on the morning shift and then engaged in a battle with a pickpocket. My dad being a rather large ex-jail guard won but was very shaken up. Just be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Solo - thank god”
Reviews.Author: essther
Reviews.Content: Don't stay in room 406 unless you are alone. I understand that rooms in Europe are going to be small, but this was tiny for sure. Hotel was OK - great location, "business center" = a computer near the elevator and the "bar" was never attended unless you asked the front desk gentleman to come off-duty and fix you a drink. The elevator was out of service on multiple occasions. Very frustrating and it seemed not to be a shock to the employees. Great location as mentioned, and the room was clean, but still - not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, but overpriced and tiny”
Reviews.Author: shendrix
Reviews.Content: The location is awesome, but this hotel is grossly overrated. The quality of the rooms is at best, 3 star. It is on par with a Holiday Inn in the USA. The furniture is Ikea style, laminate floors, and very poor quality mattresses. I had a very hard time sleeping in them. If you do not upgrade to a triple room, you will have a room the size of a shoe box. For the money I ended up spending to upgrade to a triple, I could have stayed in a nicer hotel in a nicer room. I wished I would have stayed in Hotel Neri.

Reviews.Title: “What can I say but excellent!”
Reviews.Author: ladeam99
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and oh so convenient with a super staff who found the answers. We would definitely stay there again. The breakfast was a very good way to begin the day.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it here and the service is great!”
Reviews.Author: SasaB_10
Reviews.Content: We visited a few cities on our honeymoon and the hotel in the first city (Rome) sucked so we were keeping our fingers crossed for all the hotels after that and this one was the answer to our prayers! When we arrived they greeted us with champaign! We then went to our room that was clean and comfortable. It is located right off of La Rambla which is very convienient and there are a lot of great little resturants all around not to mention lots of shops. The best thing about this hotel is the service. Nunu was the best! All the guys at the front desk were very helpful! We realized the morning we were supposed to leave that our travel agent booked our flight for the wrong day and with their help we were able to get a flight out right away. I would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lynne033
Reviews.Content: This hotel is minutes from La Rambla and underground trains. Excellent location and very friendly and helpful staff. Speak excellent English. Rooms are very good and beds are very comfortable. Rooms at the front of the Hotel are the best, so ask for these when booking. Very nice restaurant for excellent breakfast. Not many shops are open on Sunday. Watch out for pickpockets - they are rife! Leave valuables in hotel room safe. If you take the Raco Gift of champagne and chocolates, you need to ask for them as they are not automatically put in your room.

Reviews.Title: “STOP SEARCHING! This is what you are looking for!”
Reviews.Author: Orkaem
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel in TripAdvisor and was surprised by all the good comments, since the price per room was really low! So we booked and yes, it was great!! No frills but excellent location, in the heart of Barcelona, while quiet and clean!! And by heart, I mean shopping, sightings, restaurants, everything!!! We didn't pay for breakfast but there is a shop selling sandwiches right across the entrance and they serve great capuccino at the Placa Sant Josep near it. Also, you can use the common computer to surf the net and print your ticket for free. If you plan to get the shuttle bus from the airport to the city, do it bearing in mind that the bus stop is around 5 minutes on foot away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Where you want to be”
Reviews.Author: asg2588
Reviews.Content: The best part is the location. Close to all the main attractions in the heart of the city but in the Gothic streets amazingly beautiful! Close to transport and lovely hidden restaurants. Good price, small but tidy. Staff were great but online booking process was attrocious as they promised a deal they could not deliver on, however once we got there forgot all about it and were so so happy!.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SushiDeLuxe_1974
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 9AM, check-in was possible as from 2PM. We left the luggage in the luggage room and went into the city. Upon checkin, we got a glass of cava, the staff was very friendly. We got a very small room on the top floor. Free wifi was working. Downstairs is a PC with printer, which can be used at no cost. The deposit box in the room was not included in the room price. The breakfast is good. Very good location in the Gothic Quarter close to the Paça Catalunya (airport express and lots of shopping), the Rambla (don't miss the Mercat de la Boqueria, but don't step into the tapas tourist traps on the Rambla: expensive and not good to eat) and the Rambla del Mar (the MareMagnum mall is also open on Sundays but there's no Zara) next to the harbour. Watch out for pickpockets in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Merryweather21
Reviews.Content: Greeted with a glass of cava on arrival,the hotel is in a great location in the Barri Gottic,just off La Ramblas.We had a lovely room overlooking the internal courtyard.Air-con is quiet and effective,beds were comfy,bathroom well stocked with toiletries and all was very clean. Coffee,tea and water is available in the bar in the afternoons along with pastries and you just help yourself. Breakfast is very good,a lot of choice of hot and cold food, fruit, juices tea and coffee ect.We booked through Alpharooms and paid a very good price for 6 nights b&b. We got the Aerobus from PL.Cantalunya for 5 euros,it's a 5 min walk from the hotel and they run about every 20 mins to the airport.Use the HOHO bus,deffinatly the best way to see the city.Barcelona is very expensive although there are the usual fast food places and cheaper bar/resturants down the side streets. Watch your bags and wallets,there are a lot of pick-pockets,don't let anyone stop you on the street and try to give you leaflets,my husband almost had his wallet taken from his front pocket! But don't let that put you off,Barcelona is a beautiful city and we had a fantastic time, just keep your wits about you! oh,by the way,Park Guell is at the top of a very long and steep hill,worth it,but the guide books didn't say that!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: ozkay
Reviews.Content: Just backed from Barcelona yesterday. Our stay in H10 Raco Del Pi was faultless. The location is extremely convenient. - only a few minutes walk from the airport bus stop on Placa Cantalunya. It's right in the middle of the shopping area. Rooms are clean. I saw some reviews saying the rooms are a bit on the small end, but I found it adequate given that you are only their for a few hour sleep. Bathrooms are clean, shower with good pressure. Breakfast was excellent. Staffs are very helpful. Will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little Hotel - Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MisterMisterMike
Reviews.Content: We Stayed here for 3 very enjoyable nights in this small compact centrally located Hotel. Be careful if you get the top floor room as it is a very small room and the tiny glazed windows offer no view as they are at floor level (Except for the skylight)!! We managed to change to a much nicer room! We strongly recommend the breakfast for 8 euros which was great value. A fabulous self-serve buffet offering a great selection of fresh, top quality, ingredients that set us up for a busy day ahead!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thepooleys
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and we would certainly recommend this to anyone. It is in a great location - close to all attractions but tucked in a little side street so you're not in the centre of everything. The room was small yet clean and had a balcony over looking the street, this was a little noisy over the weekend compared to the week but not a major problem for us. Breakfast was expensive so we used a cafe on the corner to get coffee and pastries which were really good value. The staff are extremley helpful and gave us recommendations of where to eat during our three nights all of which were great places They also suggested taking an open top bus to explore the city and if you purchased the tickets from reception they were slightly cheaper than if brought at the kiosk.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Stay !”
Reviews.Author: sassy125
Reviews.Content: I've just arrived back home from a short stay in Barcelona and found this hotel perfect for our needs ! We took the Aerobus from outside the airport to the city centre at 5 euros each and the hotel was only a 5 min walk away. The rooms are a bit on the small side but they were clean and comfortable. We didnt eat breakfast here too expensive ! And there are plenty of cafes around the area. Hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. The best way getting around and about is to go on the open top buses ! Its a great way to explore the city and a 2 day pass is around 27 euros. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, very good value for money and you couldn't get a better location !

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: sunlolly_uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights mon-fri. Weather clear blue skies, warm in the sun but a bit chilly in the shade. All cafes and restaurants had seating outside which we thought we might miss out on by going in March so we were pleased by this, Many also had the outdoor heaters for al fresco dining in the evening - and many were busy. Great atmosphere. Everyone very friendly and helpful. We did some research before going and decided the cheapest option was to get the Renfe train from the airport. We asked where to get it from at the tourist info booth before exiting the airport. A very short walk through the terminal took us to the small platform where there is a machine to buy tickets. We opted for a T10 ticket for 7.50euro.This gives 10 journeys and can be used on the metro and buses. simply swipe through the machine for yourself then pass to your partner. This is two journeys which lasts about 1 hour or so and will enable you to get off at Sants and jump on the metro to Licieu on La Ramblas. Bingo and all for approx 75p each - much cheaper than a taxi and more fun. You still have 8 journeys left and can get yourself back to the airport aswell. As for pickpockets we were very vigilent and saw no trouble at all. The hotel is perfectly placed and is exactly as described previously. Spotlessly clean and staff willingly to offer advice whenever needed. There was a good mix of guests also. Breakfast buffet was exellent with loads on offer. We had paid extra for B&B knowing full well we would want a leisurely breakfast with more than one cup of coffee and glass of juice each. The restaurant was small and had a nice feel to it. We were pleased although you could grab a smaller breakfast within 10 paces if prefered for around 5-8 euros each. I have to admit we were disappointed with the room. We requested and got a double bed but the room itself was tiny to say the least with a side window onto a brick wall. It felt oppressive and the air con seemed to make it warmer in there so we stopped using it. We had no problem with street noise and it was nice not to hear the busy traffic. I would stay again but would hope for a balcony room at the front. I suppose these are high on everyones wish list though. We travelled via metro and on foot and particularly liked Poble Espanyol and Parc Guell, we took a picnic to Guell and had tapas at one of the nice cafe bars at Poble espanyol. We explored Gracia, Barri Gotic El born etc on foot. We found Beer to be expensive and it cheaper to drink cava sangria or cava by the glass. Also If you fancy sampling a flamenco show we found a short half hour show for 7 euros each right on Placa Raeal- Torontos i think it was called. We ate many tapas and liked Sinatras restaurant just on the side alley near Placa Raeal. Overall Barcelona is a fascinating city with lots on offer. There are hundreds of hotels but this one has to be the best location. Dont be put off by all the graffiti - it is everywhere and is only ever on the shop shutters so is more apparent at night. It is situated on a safe busy and well lit street right in the hub of everything so is perfect in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Pabloisno1
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews on here before we went and booked hotel, can't complain, had a fantastic 3 nights in Barcelona. Hotel staff / breakfast and reception very friendly, room very good, but they are small, the location is fantastic, just a few streets off la Ramblers, thank goodness ! We used the metro throughout our stay including Renfe to and from Barcelona, everything is easy access from the hotel. Can't wait to go back, we were lucky with weather as well, lovely and sunny

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, pity about the beds”
Reviews.Author: TravellingScribe
Reviews.Content: The location in the Barrio Gotico can hardly be bettered. I expected it to be noisy late at night and in the small hours but it wasn't. Pleasant room, everything you need in the bathroom. Very friendly staff at reception and in the breakfast room. As other reviewers have said, the breakfast is extremely good - a very wide choice from hot English/American dishes to good quality European style cold meats, cheeses etc, plus breads, cakes, cereals, yoghurt, and a wide variety of fresh fruits. Good coffee too... in fact, great coffee and excellent food everywhere we went in Barcelona during a 5 day trip. Not surprising perhaps when you see the quality of the produce in La Boqueria market. The only downsides were: 1. Our room was very dark - no real natural light but perhaps can't be helped because of the narrow laneways. This may not bother everyone; and 2. More importantly, the beds are just standard double beds which means quite narrow and quite short. I asked at reception and they said all the rooms had the same size beds. I know this isn't pretending to be a 5-star hotel but I do think queen size beds are fairly normal for 4 star hotels these days and there would be enough space for them in this hotel's rooms. Unless you and your partner are two short, very skinny people, you may find it difficult to get a good night's rest. Let me finish on a high note: the welcome glass of prosecco, the availability of apples and bonbons (sweets to the English) at reception and the help-yourself free afternoon coffee, tea and croissants or cakes are very nice touches.

Reviews.Title: “\friendly, clean ,nicely decorated and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: CorkStarbucks
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in Raco del Pi and were pleasently surprised, the hotel staff were very welcoming and friendly. We were greeted with a glass of cava and there was compl ementary pastries and coffee in the pm. The location was perfect and because the street was pedestrianised it was nice and quiet at night .The breakfast was lovely and catered for all tastes.The weather was very cold while we were there so we were delighted to have a nice hot bath/jacussi at night. I would certainly stay there again and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, affordable--on some nights”
Reviews.Author: bakio
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights here over New Years. The location is just perfect; close to everything and on a street that seemed safe at all hours. Very clean and well maintained hotel. We had two rooms on the fourth floor. One was not much larger than a boat cabin with one small window at your feet. That said, in Barcelona there is so much to do 24/7 that you don't spend any time in your room other than to sleep for a few hours and recharge to head back out for more of this fabulous city, so the diminutive room really did not matter. The other room was bigger with a large window that opened into a central courtyard. We found this room to be very quiet, considering that the hotel is smack in the center of one of the most non-stop parts of Barcelona. Over the New Year's holiday, the room rates tripled from the rates we paid in the four days preceding the holiday; we did not think the tiny room was a good value at all for the 3x rate. I would stay here again, definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Friendly staff...”
Reviews.Author: RogieBear
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the Gothic part of the city. A bit tricky to locate if you are unfamiliar because it is on a small street off of plaza del Pi. Through a bit f research we found out that the name Plaza del Pi was given because of the lone Pine tree in the plaza, the only one in the area... The hotel was immaculate and the gentleman at the front desk was intelligent, friendly and more than willing to help. He made dinner reservations for us, called the taxi and gave us some wonderful tips on how to get around the town. My father is very familiar with Barcelona and was also very pleased with the suggestions. This is a very highly rated hotel, and because we were there during off-peak dates, we saved a good deal on our stay. There are great shops nearby, (one great italian men's clothing store within about a hundred feet of the hotel. If anyone can identify it, I would appreciate the info.) Also about two blocks away from the famous Ramblas; a main avenue with tons of great shopping and food. The metro is also just 2-3 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Great Location, Excellent Value & Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: hilibug
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my husband, mother in law & sister in law over the holidays (Dec. 2009). Had a very good stay!!! The location couldn't be better. The rooms were comfortable and quiet and the staff were VERY accomodating and always willing to help. The glass of cava as a welcome was lovely and we would all four very easily reccomend this hotel to friends/family that visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: georgief
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for four nights in November. The hotel staff were incredibly friendly and always ready to offer advice on places to go. The room was a good size and was very clean. Ours was on the second floor with a balcony. You could hear a little bit of noise from outside but not so that it disturbed us. The only downside was that there isn't much sound-proofing between rooms. We couldn't hear people talking, but could hear loos flushing etc. You also get free pastries and tea/coffee in the bar after 12pm - great for when you come back tired after a long day of sight seeing. It's in a great location, moments from Las Ramblas and we were able to walk to most places quite easily. The metro is very easy to use and is recommended for places a bit further away. We bought a T-10 ticket for around 7 euros which allows you ten trips on any form of public transport. It's also great because two people can use the same ticket - just swipe it through a second time for the second traveller - so it's useful if you only need a couple of journeys each.

Reviews.Title: “service needs work”
Reviews.Author: PacificNorthwestBest
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in November for our honeymoon. First off I should mention that I email the hotel twice asking for a specific room, each time I asked them to return my email and each time my email was not returned. Upon arrival we were sent to the room I requested and as soon as we opened the door the room was uncleaned and not ready for us to check in. We were given a room at the back of the hotel which didn't seem as nice. Also other guests were offered Cava upon check in but not us. You would think that with the mistake they made and our mention of a honeymoon they would have at least treated us as well as other guests, but no. Also there was a bit of a line at the front the desk and a man seemed to sit there on the computer not helping any guests. Our room could have been a little cleaner and free of hairs that didn't belong to us. Also the WiFi didn't work all the time, you couldn't depend on it. The location is good.

Reviews.Title: “All-round excellence”
Reviews.Author: madamealfredcarriere
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights in November and found the hotel to be excellent in every way. The reception staff were friendly and extremely helpful; the room was spotless and felt very secure; the public areas were similarly clean and welcoming and the hotel itself was within very easy reach on foot of many of Barcelona's attractions - a perfect place. I cannot recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jjordan370
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights . The hotel is a 2 minute walk from La Rambla near Liceu Metro stop. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful. A nice touch is glasses of champagne awaiting you as you check in. We had room 201 which overlooked the atrium. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean modern rooms, just a few small issues”
Reviews.Author: TorontoGuy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very well located as it is right in the middle of the Barri Gotic, surrounded by interesting shops, and very close to La Rambla. It is an easy walk to the very cool area of El Born to the East and also very easy to get to the subway. The room was clean and modern and a good size, with a very good sized bathroom that had a full size tub/shower. The water pressure was so strong it actually made the handheld showerhead rotate back in the swivelled base it could be set in. Staff was young and quite helpful. We were given an excellent suggestion for a restaurant for dinner by one of the concierges and they were also helpful in helping us to locate places on the map they provided.
