As mentioned on this board, we also found that cabs never seemed to want to take us directly to the hotel, as the streets are very narrow and largely pedestrian. This was only really an issue for us when we were arriving to the hotel from the airport and got dropped off with our luggage in the middle of a crowded square and had to figure out where the hotel was, which was a bit frustrating, but ultimately it wasn't that hard to find. The other issue was the bed. In Europe, a double or king bed is almost always two twin beds positioned next to each other, which was the case here. This is usually is not a big deal, but the beds in our room were on wheels and even though we tried to lock the wheels in place, the beds moved around a lot. When we were trying to treat the two beds together like one big bed, the beds kept separating and one person was always falling down in the ever-widening chasm between the beds, so ultimately we had to just sleep individually in each twin bed, which isn't very romantic. But generally speaking the hotel is a great base from which to see the city and is relatively reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: trinty
Reviews.Content: if your thinking of booking this hotel ,book we loved it ,great location ,cosy hotel ,breakfast very good all you could want fruit ,cold meats cheeses ,cakes mmmm hot choice eggs bacon ect ,rooms were very nice ,flat screen ,fridge all modern ,we walked from bus station nord took 20 mins get tour bus tickets from reception and off you go !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeniseH
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at Raco Del Pi in Room 203 overlooking the street with a balcony. The room was large with a great bathroom and excellent toiletries provided. Safe in the room which you have to get a key from reception. Staff were friendly and helpful. We did not have any problems with noise and loved the location and would definitely stay there again and recommend anyone to stay there. No problem for us re the taxi drop off etc as we did not use but only 5 mins walk to hotel from Pl de Catalunya. We also found it close enough to walk to the cruise ship port. Excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Barcelona for strolling around, small room !”
Reviews.Author: BasherEssex
Reviews.Content: Although we had asked when booking for a room with a balcony and after reading previous reviews, not on the fourth floor, on arrival we were allocated room 206 which was no bigger than a box room with a double bed squeezed in. As we were on a 3 night stay, we asked to be changed to something bigger and were offered a slightly bigger room on the fourth floor which had a tiny floor level window so no view, but it did have a skylight which made it quite a bright room. Staff were very helpful. Internet worked only infrequently. Hotel is ideally situated in middle of the Gotic district which made for frequent wanders around this atmospheric area. Would highly recomend the nearby Cafe L'Academia for a superb if not slightly expensive meal, although we only managed to get the last table for two at 8:40pm on a Saturday night so suggest booking ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sfnewyork
Reviews.Content: Basically a lower mid-range hotel that charges high-end prices because of its great location. Rooms are clean but spartan, front desk service very indifferent, few amenities--but walking distance to many of the city's most interesting sights. If you're willing to pay the high prices for the rooms and don't intend to spend much time at the hotel anyway, a safe bet. If you're looking for more amenities and better service, keep looking. Stay away from the first floor rooms if you can as they open onto a noisy interior court. Internet service rarely worked, breakfast not included in room price.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing! We don't recommend. More like a 2 star, not 3 star.”
Reviews.Author: ConnecticutLil
Reviews.Content: Only good thing is location & yes, the staff is polite & apologizes for everything. We stayed 9/1-9/3-2 nights. Tiny room (408), over $700USD + E15pp for minimal buffet bkfast + if you can believe it, E8 for key to in-closet safe. No one to help bring bags to room. No internet connection on the 1 & only computer & printer, so could not print boarding passes. etc. No luggage rack, so suitcases all over the floor in very small room, TV was iffy, keycard necessary to put on lights, 1 very small bar of soap at sink - none for bath. I could go on, but you get the idea. The complimentary glass of Cava in the afternoon does not make up for the many problems and inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Lyngra68
Reviews.Content: Staff polite,Room rate expensive, breakfast too dear, Charge for security box in room a bit petty when paying 269 euros/night for room only. Only local channels on TV despite International advertised. Room[207] must be the smallest anywhere in the world. Fittings,bed,bedding and towels of cheap quality. Even soap supplied was miniscule and only 1 piece. Bathroom good although you needed to be less than 1.4m tall to fit in. Best thing that could be said was good location

Reviews.Title: “Luvly central but quiet hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gayn040
Reviews.Content: I went for new year with my lads (15 & 11) and stayed for 3 nights. The hotel was so nice, modern and freindly. Just around the corner from the Ramblas on a nice quiet, charming side street in the heart of the Gothic quarter. Our room sleeping 3, in 3 proper beds no put-me-up in sight! was very spacious, cleaned daily beds and towels. We had a small balcony, which was nice 2 watch all go by.The bathroom was all marble, twin sinks with a jacuzzi bath by the window, so if u wished you could open the shutters and watch the stars twinkle. A excellent stay and new year break.

Reviews.Title: “Near it all, decent price for a solid room”
Reviews.Author: Boston519
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were pleased to find this location right off Las Ramblas near 3 subway stations inside Barri Gotic. We were able to walk to most places -- whether the Cathedral or Barceloneta. There is a great churros/chocolate place around the corner. The front desk was helpful and the room was clean and modern. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “basic, simple, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Knoedeltester
Reviews.Content: ...location, location, location...the hotel itself is very basic, rooms are simple furnished, breakfast plain, staff efficient but not overly friendly. I let my fiancée book accommodation for our short get-away. Being used to 5 star hotels I was pleasantly surprised about the hotel. It's clean and one can even spend a rainy afternoon there. Only negative point was the internet access....there was only one PC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location, definitely book again!”
Reviews.Author: SuzeNorthYorks
Reviews.Content: We flew to Girona Airport which is about an hour and a quarter away on the Barcelona Bus (21 Euros return) very easy and on time. As Metro was difficult to find we got a taxi to hotel, he dropped us off on Las Ramblas and we had to find it ourselves!!! (Taxis DO stop outside hotel.) 13 Euros. The street is NOT directly off Las Ramblas so get a street map first. We joined the H10 club (hotel website) which was free and gave us a few privileges - glass of champagne on arrival. Hotel is very clean, smart, attentive and helpful staff. We were given room 409 which had a roof window and two very small knee height windows with frosted glass in. When you opened the small windows there were bricks behind and the noise and heat of the street came through. Not too much of a problem but after the first day we did begin to feel closed in and as we were there for a week we asked if we could change rooms. No problem, they gave us room 401 which was so much better - large window you could open right up, and an even larger bathroom. So when booking, I would suggest you request a window you can see out of!. One more thing, if you opt for twin beds, they slide very easily across the floor!!!! Next to the lift is a computer and printer free to use with free WIFI. Very good beach which was a half hour walk, beware - lots of male nudity!!!! Also Thai ladies doing massages (5 Euros for 15 mins, excellent!) Lots of things to do in Barcelona, could do with two weeks instead of one! Dissapointed couldn't find any dancing in the evening tho everywhere very busy. Will be staying here again, felt very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “very nice basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: homebodyfromutah
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said, this hotel is very basic but clean, well managed, extremely centrally located and quiet. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was great, we arrived early (at 8am) and left even earlier (at 4 am) and the staff at the hotel were welcoming and helpful. The rooms are small, but not too small. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: NomadLovebird
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic little hotel right in the middle of the Barri Gotic. If you are looking for a great, comfortable hotel close to everything then look no further. My only gripe about this hotel is that it was hard to find when my taxi first dropped me off from Las Rambles. Once I found the hotel the gentleman at the front desk gave me a map and marked our location and directions to the nearest sights. Once you learn that the hotel is just around the corner from the Barcelona Cathedral then you can find the hotel from anywhere in the city....as long as you can find the cathedral! You're also equally close to Las Rambles and the Bouqueria and Port Vell which is a spectacular sight as well. I stayed in room 107 which had a lovely door that opened up to a small alley at the back of the hotel. The room was plenty spacious for two people and the bathroom was also generously sized. I had friends that stayed together in room 406 (which is a single) and they also had plenty of space. You could hear the bells of the cathedral from your room (they stop at night.) My room also had color TV, shower/tub, bidet and little hotel products like soap/shampoo/conditioner, etc. The bed was plenty comfortable and I had no problems with noise or not being able to sleep. There is a beautiful indoor/outdoor courtyard in the middle of the hotel to sit/relax/eat whatever. We walked everywhere from this hotel...to La Sagrada Familia and the Picasso Museum without any trouble. There is also close access to the Barcelona Bus Turistic which goes all over the city to all the sights. Oh and there's FREE internet access in the lobby (they have a computer for your use) as well as spotty free wi-fi throughout the building. I couldn't believe how I lucked out and found this little gem within the city. I would hands-down stay there again and recommend to anyone I know. It was relatively inexpensive and for the location you cannot beat this place. I found the staff to be VERY helpful and friendly...they offer you a glass of Kava on your arrival, wonderful little candies in the lobby and fresh apples too! The decor is fantastic (very Barcelona). You do have to pay to use the safe in your room but it is a nominal charge. I left my camera out on the bed numerous times and the balcony door open while I was out and I never felt threatened or that my valuables were at risk.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: lcw1983
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel at the beginning of July 2009 with my boyfriend, I had been to Barcelona a couple of times and knew I wanted to stay in the gothic quarter and I think the area is beautiful and is a great central location to see the rest of barcelona. The hotel was great, the rooms are quite small but that didn't matter one bit, our room was facing on the side of the hotel which meant we didn't near any noise from the street below. It was about 30 degrees when we went and the room was the perfect temperature, nice and cool. I would definately stay here again if I came to Barlcelona. found the reception staff very helpful too, helped us book taxi's and change restaurant bookings.

Reviews.Title: “Some quibbles, but all in all a great choice”
Reviews.Author: ericnyc
Reviews.Content: If you don't have fancypants needs in a hotel, but you want a great centrally-located place to explore Barcelona, book the Raco del Pi. The rooms aren't pretty small and utilitarian, but they're superclean and have very nice bathrooms. The staff were "helpfully unhelpful" but all very kind and warm. We felt both the room rate and the breakfast were a bit overpriced, but it's ultimately worth it because of the incredible location. Being able to walk through the gothic quarter late at night after dinner is a true joy. There's tons of shops and restaurants right outside the hotel. And Barcelona is an absolutely stunning city, with amazing energy. If you stay at the hotel for a few days, you'll probably end up spending about $100 more than you'd like, but all told it's worth it for an overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem right in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Dohertys
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Raco Del Pi twice before and have just booked our third visit. This hotel is everything we could ask for from a European destination. As a couple, we want to be close to all the sights, have comfortable, clean and affordable accomodation but want those little extra touches to make our stay memorable - with Raco Del Pi we got it all. From start to finish, we LOVED this hotel. It was a little hard to find at first (since it's off the Ramblas on one of the side streets), but once we'd found it, it's location was one of the most appealing aspects of the hotel. We were glad we weren't in one of the many hotels on the main thoroughfare - the little street it's situated on, with it's myriad of little speciality shops (ice cream, cafes, chocolatier etc.) was beautiful. We were greeted by very charming and helpful staff on both occasions upon our arrival and the complimentary Cava and fresh fruit were a very nice touch during check-in. Staff were better than excellent and since our Spanish isn't very good - we were glad their English was great. The room allocated on our first visit was spacious with good facilities - but don't go there to spend time in your room watching TV if you only speak English. Chanel selection wasn't great. On our second visit, the room was small - we literally had to back into the bathroom - but even so - it was very clean and had all amenities we could want. Hey... it's Europe... embrace the closeness and get to know your partner a bit better! We took breakfast on our second visit at the hotel and it was very good (our first visit - we ate at a couple of the little bar/cafes close by). Airport journey is easy and the drop off (at Placa de Catalunya) isn't a million miles away from the hotel - so you should walk it in about 5 minutes. Bus fare was cheap and you can go back to Placa de Catalunya to catch the bus tours. Hotel is extremely well located though... a short stroll to the Gothic Quarter and Ramblas. If you're looking for a great base from which to see Barcelona... stop looking... this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice (but earplugs needed at night for front room)”
Reviews.Author: RobCh
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Raco del Pi during an April pre-cruise stay in Barcelona. This hotel met all of our expectations: fantastic location, clean and comfortable room (with a real double bed), delicious breakfast (included in our rate) and nothing but great service. Our corner room (104) was on the 1st floor (right above the entrance's porch) and faced the pedestrian street. We had 2 balconies with double doors that opened into our room and gave us a great feel for being apart of the Barcelona Bari Gothic scene. We loved the atmosphere, the vibrant feel and the noise that came from the narrow street during the day and evening. The view was also great from the balcony (see pictures). Only issue (and this is not meant to discourage people to book this hotel) was that the old doors are not sufficient to isolate the room from the noise from the street (with echo) at nighttime. Earplugs did the trick for us (we were prepared) but again this is not unusual if you want to be in the old town of Barcelona (and we encourage you to choose that location to be "in the heart of it". We felt a bit strange being asked by the front desk attendant (Gherard) for a 70 euros premium to have that room, and even stranger when told by the same Gherard that this premium had to be paid in cash (...), buy hey, nevermind (...), this was still well worth it ! We recommend the small counter in front of the hotel (La Bagetina Catalana) for sandwiches and snacks which they will heat up for you and you can take to your room. All in all, a great choice and we highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location”
Reviews.Author: Berkeley_Sue
Reviews.Content: This H10 hotel is located right in the middle of Barcelona's old town. It could not possibly be in a better location. The front desk was friendly, and we were given a glass of champagne at check in, which was nice. Breakfast is was not included, but we ate breakfast at the Mercat de Sant Josep/ La Boqueria, which we HIGHLY reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: PanseyWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Room 304 which was very nice as it had two windows and overlooked the street. The room was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. The staff on reception were friendly and helpful and the free tea and coffee in the afternoons was very welcome. The hotel is situated on a beautiful street with the cathedral at the end and a beautiful little square with some excellent restaurants and bars (especially the Bar del Pi which we loved). Loved Barcelona and would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok at the right price”
Reviews.Author: CL_Cardiff
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and friendly staff but can be expensive and the acommodation is nothing special. We stayed in March 2009 having booked directly with the hotel and were being charged between 120 and 140EUR per night without breakfast. The room wasn't great. It was fairly small and very basic with cheap laminate floors. It was overheated (as it was in the roof) with no air conditioning available, only heating, and the window opened as a single pane right into the room making it very awkward to get around. The window was on an atrium which was overlooked. We had requested a room at the front on booking and when checking in but were told none were available. The only other rooms available were equally poky and internal facing. It was very disappointing having read the positive reviews here and we have stayed in many better hotels in Barcelona, also with excellent locations but never previously paid as much as this. At the right price it would be ok for a short trip. We stayed for one night only and cancelled our other bookings, having found other hotels nearby to be significantly cheaper and of a higher standard of comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location ; No frills”
Reviews.Author: ThirtyishDeb
Reviews.Content: The H10 Raco Del Pi is in an excellent location just off Las Ramblas. When we arrived, we were advised that our room would not be ready for a couple of hours as they were 'changing the beds'. I was a little confused until we arrived outside our room and they were actually swapping the old beds for new beds! As a result, we didn't receieve any cava on arrival, but the complimentary coffee (and croissant) was a nice touch after a long day sight-seeing (served after 2pm). Our room was 403 on the top floor. As mentioned in a previous review, it had a small window in the floor which felt a little claustraphobic to begin with. It was also quite small, but clean. We were offered breakfast at a special offer of 10 euro per person, which we declined. Safe keys are an extra 2 - 3 euros per day. Would I stay here again - Not sure as there's plenty more choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabby location once there but as it's pedestianised you have to carry your luggage through some streets”
Reviews.Author: LBB22
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 days in Barcelona staying at Raco di Pi. An excellent location for all the sights. Our only gripe was that as it's pedestrianised you have to carry your luggage to and from the hotel. Not usually an issue I guess but when it is torrential rain (as it was for 3 of the days) then you get soaked going to Placa de Catalanya for a taxi, with your luggage in tow. Anyway, really great staff, breakfast very limited, fruit, some ham, yogurt but ok if already B & B. Difficult to find anything that's not croissant type for breakfast elsewhere - don't they know croisannts are 12 weight watchers points each!!"!! We stayed in room 309 which was facing the central atrium looking down into the terrace. Nice and quiet. Only problem with the room was the ineffective air conditioning. It must be a real problem when the sun shines. So, unless they fix it, don't take that room. Any of the 307, 308 or 207/8/9 would be good though location wize if they have aircon that works. Oh, forgot to say, the beds are 1st class. (two pushed together for a double). Overall def return to this hotel in an instant!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location with friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: miriamlinda
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and found this hotel to be in an excellent position for many of the tourist attractions in the city centre. It is close to the Ramblas, the Cathedral and is in the picturesquwe Old City. We did not eat breakfast in the Hotel but there are many small cafes, tapas bars and restaurants within walking distance. Many restaurants offer good value Menus of the Day. The room we had was on the fourth floor, had no window but a skylight and small floor window gave adequate light and there was a good size bathroom with half bath, adequate shower, hairdryer and small toiletries. The room was kept very clean. We found the reception staff friendly and helpful. We would definately recommend this hotel for a short stay and not least for those contemplating visiting Barcelona for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great staff, would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: emailqueenuk
Reviews.Content: A hotel almost without fault - from our arrival with a glass of cava to sorting out a late check-out and taxi, the staff were helpful and polite and made our stay really enjoyable. It's in a fantastic location - a few minutes from the Ramblas, a short walk from the Gothic quarter and Placa de Catalunya, near the shops, market, cathedral and some great tapas restaurants. The rooms are spacious - ours was at the back of the hotel, so not much of a view but no noise - and the minibar not too extortionate, lovely shower and bath and a good breakfast, although it's pricy if it's not included (and there is free coffee and croissants during the day in the lounge), although playing Muse during breakfast is a distinct bonus. We needed the extra blanket against the cold, but the heating worked well - and I expect the air con would be as good during summer. Sadly the weather was too cold and rainy to sit out in the inner courtyard. The only drawbacks is the loud plumbing which gurgles impressively and if you're unlucky enough to be in a room next to a German couple having a large argument (as we were) you can hear every syllable. Having said that, the walls aren't so thin that you can hear every noise if people are talking normally, so we were just unlucky. For a central location, even the price was great. I'm already planning to go back to Barcelona, and I'll definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dfcf62
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights at Raco del Pi, best rate available was from the H10 website and we asked for and got a balcony room. After cava on arrival we were given room 203, not huge but more than acceptable in size and quality and nice view of the street Overall very happy with location, service & price

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Kelleth
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay in the Raco. The location in the Gothic Quarter was perfect, less than a 5 minute walk from La Rambla (turn left out of the hotel and left again at the end of the street) and just a few steps from one of the prettiest squares in Barcelona from where you can lose yourself in the maze of streets. We were given a glass of cava on arrival and told that internet use was free and tea/coffee/croissants were also complementary after 2pm, though we only took advantage of this once as we were out sightseeing. The room was modern (no kettle though so I would advise to take a travel kettle if you enjoy your morning cup of tea - although there are plenty of cafes nearby) and we were lucky enough to get one of the rooms with a balcony overlooking the beautiful street (we had emailed the hotel in advance to request this but we were not sure whether we would be successful). The bathroom had a shower over the half size bath - shower gel/shaving kit/tooth brushes/shampoo etc all provided. We did find that the room was very warm - we tried to use the air con but it seemed to blow out more hot air, so we just left the balcony door open - but this was our only complaint. Barcelona itself was fabulous - although we found it extremely expensive to eat/drink, even when we took into account the poor exchange rate and the fact that we were in the city centre - luckily we found a Spar round the corner for snacks/drinks, not very spanish I know but we refused to pay 3 euros for a can of pop. The gothic quarter is beautiful, we also found the La Ribera district incredibly atmospheric, (this is the area that separates the gothic quarter from the Arc de Triomph/city park) the streets are so narrow here and they open out onto lovely palm tree squares. We used the cable car from the Port across to Montjuic - but I would advise you to save your euros and go up the lift located in the Christopher Columbus monument, the views from the top are just as good and its far easier to get to than the cable car. I would recommend you buy a pass for the Metro system to get around the city as it covers a vast area - we paid 10 euros for a 2 day ticket and you can also use this on the bus/tram/train (get the 24 bus to Parc Guell as the metro stops at the bottom of the rather steep hill) Overall we had a fantastic time and would definately go again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: qualityspy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel 19th -22nd Jan and overall couldn't fault it in terms of value and location. Stayed in room 104, which is first floor at the front of the hotel with a balcony over the main street. OK - the rooms are not particularly spacious and the bathroom was very tiny - but everything worked, it was comfortable and perfectly clean. TV had CNN and SKY news in English - which was fine - (let's be fair - you don't go to Barcelona to watch TV!) Last year we stayed at Hotel Jazz for a similar price, which has better rooms, but is not so well located - so it depends what your priorities are. There is some noise in the night from street cleaning, church bells if you are at the front of the hotel and from showers etc in neighbouring rooms - but haven't found a city centre hotel yet where something like this didn't happen. Reception staff were all really polite and helpful and gave sensible advice when asked. Didn't bother with breakfast, as even at the discounted rate of 9 euros pp, it is miles cheaper to stop at any of the nearby cafes for coffee and tostadas etc. Word of warning re: attempts to part you from your belongings (which is always a problem in Barcelona) - beware a couple of small senoritas along the water front area attempting to get you to sign what purports to be a school petition. When you refuse they run after you tugging your arm in the hope you will give in. If you do, an adult standing nearby will attempt to part you from your bag. We knew this con from last year and apart from a mouthful of abuse when refused stop - nothing bad happened.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: Ghauri75
Reviews.Content: We went for a Xmas break and choose it for its prime location, when we saw our room we both thought.... its tiny!! i mean how were we both going to get changed and move around in it??? It had no natural light only a tiny window near our feet with the view of a buildings roof!!! There was no tea, coffee or water in the room not a single english channel on the oversized TV. Tiles in the shower were mouldy, No Clock ...basics we expect from a 3 star in europe!!! When asked to move we were told the hotel was full. As for the free tea and pastries at reception....well the tea tasted like TCP (Had to buy tea from down the round every evening, so its not the milk they use in spain as we first thought)and the coffee had been brewing all day so was like tar. The pasties were hard dryed up crossaints which tasted like cardboard. The room cleaning only happens in the morning, so if you want a lie in, your room doesnt get cleaned or get your towels replaced. Staff were friendly but were always trying to sell you something...the tourist bus tickets...which were such a rip up. 26 euros for a bus tickets that is always overcrowed, only ever goes in one direction...so if you see a sight and want to go back you have to sit the entire 1hour 20 minutes of the bus ride to get back to the stop you got on. As it was raining couldn't sit upstairs and see the views. The buses only run up to about 6 in the evening at some stations. Metro is so much better. Save your money and book in a hotel you can actually move around in, and know time of the day it is outside.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff & Location”
Reviews.Author: Harry031
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location, as many previous have said, and the staff are wonderful, polite and gracious to help out. The welcoming on check in was well beyond 3star expectation - glass of cava, nibbles, map with areas to be cautious of/ good areas to go shopping in etc. There is a little area with tables and chairs to sit and drink tea/coffee/water with pastries avail - any time, no charge. Our double room was very spacious and noticed the sofa could be used as fold out (double?) - and there still would have been ample room. Was rather noisy, but seemed to have someone doing major renovations nearby until midnight, then started again at 5am!! Highly recommend going to Cathedral just around the corner, in evening, as there always seemed to be something going on or performers. Sat 6pm locals come to dance their traditional dance. Other trip highlights La Casa Battlo!!!!!, Park Guell (take bus 24), and around Port Vell and the beach. Making an early start really pays off in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: skybluefan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location - right in the heart of the Bari Gotic. The rooms are very clean, comfortable and well equipped. We a had a great little balcony. As its in the heart of a busy area it can be a little noisy if you have a street facing room. The staff are very helpful and friendly. This is a good choice for a mid price hotel - a great place to stay if you plan to do lots of exploring. If you are planning on spending a lot of time in the hotel (you're in Barcelona, why would you??) you might find it a little basic. Because of its location the rooms are relatively small and the facilities a little limited (small bar, terrace, pc for internet access) but If you are there to enjoy all the wonderful things Barcelona has to offer I'd say its and ideal place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Delicious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: barcelonabid
Reviews.Content: Not overly grand, in fact quite basic (no window/view, just skylights & a window at foot level). This all sounds rather hideous, but it was a very nice hotel, helpful staff & quick & efficient maid service. Anyway, the advantage of having flat sky-lights is that you can hear if it is raining without a doubt! Breakfast was delicious! Mattresses were firm but comfy, double bed big enough. Great situation, could hear a pin drop at night, & close to La Ramblas. Only spotted one potential pick-pocket, after loads of warnings. Came away happy & loving Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: igmg
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here for weekend with my wife after reading some reviews. very happy overall with hotel. staff friendly and very approachable and helpful. i couldn't really fault them. the room was a bit small but fine. it was very clean and comfortable. TBH i would have no reservations returning to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Neilnric
Reviews.Content: I agree with many others with regards to this hotel and it's high standards. We stayed here before and after a cruise and found this to be an excellent location for all the main sights, restaurants and public transport. The rooms are quite small but very clean and the bathrooms have good facilities and every ammenity should you forget toothbrush etc. The breakfast has an excellent choice- we had paid this in with the room price and I suppose it is a little pricy if you pay separately as there are plenty of places nearby where you can get a croissant and coffee for a few Euros. The welcome Cava is a nice touch and the staff are very helpful, although I would not go with their restaurant recommendations as the one the recommended to us- Nexus was not at all Spanish! Tallas de Tapas in the square immediately to the right of the hotel offers excellent Tapas as does Xeloc to the left of the hotel. All in all a great hotel- worth paying the extra for.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the H10 .....”
Reviews.Author: Debla24
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay with my 66 year old mother at the H10 Raco Del Pi. I had stayed at the 4 star Olivia Plaza on my previous visit to Barcelona, but this hotel far exceeded my expectations in terms of price, quality and customer service for a 3 star rating. Check in was quick and simple and the welcome glass of cava was a really nice touch. Reception staff helpful in suggesting restaurants, etc. The room was spacious with sufficient wardrobe space. Twin beds with 'ever so soft' pillows and extra pillows and blankets provided. Bathroom standard size with good supply of toiletries and towels changed daily. The free afternoon coffee, tea, water and pastries were great after a day of shopping or sightseeing. Yes, the pastries were probably left overs from breakfast as suggested by another reviewer, but hey they were free and would only have been thrown away! The location was ideal - just a couple minutes off Las Ramblas. This was a last minute booking, that I made after reading other Trip Advisor recommendations - and they were not wrong. My mother and I both agree that we would definitely recommend the H10 to anyone looking for a good value for money hotel in the centre of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: nodata
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 nights at the H10 Raco Del Pi at the beginning of September. We loved it! When I booked I asked politely for a room with a balcony. Not only did we get a balcony - we got two! Our room had 14 foot ceilings and balconies with double opening doors on two walls. Does it get any better than this? Honestly, it was beyond perfect. It was quite hot the week we were there and we really appreciated the air conditioning too. This was a normally priced room, not an upgrade in any way. Many other people have mentioned the large, clean modern bathrooms, and ours fit that description as well. The location is unbeatable as well. We could walk to see so much - Las Ramblas, the beach area, La Raval, the Cathedral, many of the museums, some great shopping, loads of restaurants, and, of course, some of Gaudi's works. The metro is a few moments walk from the hotel for everything you can't get to by foot. We had nothing to complain about in the noise department. Yes, the street is full of people during the day, but even so, when we closed our doors it was quiet in the room. And at night there is hardly a soul. The staff were super friendly and helpful. We had no problems for them to solve, but they always greeted us with a smile and a friendly word whether we were coming in or going out. This hotel really lives up to its billing. I would heartily recommend it to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: croftonMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at H10 Hotel Raco del Pi Barcelona for 3 nights in August 2008. We are a mature couple who like to explore on foot, getting the real flavour of a city, its people and culture so we tend to research the location where we wish to stay thoroughly. We describe ourselves as backpackers at heart who have matured to enjoy reasonably comfortable accommodation. We chose Raco del Pi because it is conveniently located in the old city (Barrio Gotic) with narrow alleys and streets, surrounded by reasonable quality, low cost restaurants and close to Las Ramblas, subway etc and a short walk to the Plaza Catalunya shopping precinct and open top bus routes. The hotel staff were always helpful and enjoyed the welcome class of champagne on arrival. We always request a quiet room and they obliged, with the street noise from mainly foot traffic disappearing by mid evening. The room was reasonably large, bathroom was clean, a fridge in the room and air conditioned. The room was serviced daily and whilst our chosen price range does not provide 5 star sparkle, the hotel was clean and comfortable with a good shower. We will return to Raco del Pi without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, everything else about it is fine too”
Reviews.Author: Lyds76
Reviews.Content: I was not disappointed about the hotel. I knew that it wasn't a luxury hotel so did not expect that but as promised it was well located, near the shops, restaurants, market and walking distance to the sea side. It was reasonably quiet at night and clean enough. I definitely did not see any bugs or cockroaches but maybe they could have made a bit more of an effort in the bathroom. It was ok though. The free coffee and internet were appreciated. Overall, we spent very little time in the hotel and it completely did the job, I'd happily stay there again if i was in town with friends. If i was away on a romantic week end i might try something a bit more luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Exploration”
Reviews.Author: KatySpinach
Reviews.Content: Raco del Pi is so well placed and I was very pleased to agree with the other reviews on this website. The staff are indeed friendly and helpful (though one member of staff repeatedly told us to avoid the Ramblas which did start to grate). The breakfast is expensive and we found it much better to go up to the square to the Cafe del Pi, get used to waiting in Spain as they take their time. The room was clean and modern with SKY and CNN for English speakers. I would also say that we experienced no hint of a cockroach and I was surprised to read another reviewers comments on this. If you want somewhere in the thick of things that is very quiet with comfortable firm beds and polite staff, look no further!

Reviews.Title: “Gret location”
Reviews.Author: aureus30
Reviews.Content: We got the bus from the airport to Place de Catalunya, it was a 5 minute walk to the hotel, just off La Rambla. The receptionist was very friendly, we were offered a free glass of cava. The room and bathroom were very nice. There is free internet access on the ground floor, next to the bar. Breakfast is expensive 10-15 euro so we didn't have it. There is a bakery just across from the hotel (go left exiting the hotel, it's about 15 metres) that sell lovely filled croissants so I'd recommend there. Between about 2pm and 6pm in the hotel, there are croissants and rolls (presumably breakfast leftovers) on the bar along with coffee and you can help yourself for free. All in all it was an excellent hotel, only lacking a swimming pool, but there are plenty of buses to the beach. If going to the beach I would recommend going up to the far end by the Olympic Port (outside hotel Arts), the beach is a lot quieter there.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: mikemangino
Reviews.Content: Definitely enjoyed our stay at this H10 hotel. It was very close to many of the major attractions, including Las Ramblas. The hotel is down a smaller alley, so it's pretty busy during the day but is quiet at night so you can sleep. There are very many shops and restaurants in this area, so you don't have to go far for a meal or to do some shopping. Hotel staff was very nice and helpful, and offered me medicine from their personal medicine cabinet when I was feeling under the weather. Hotel room was very clean. Bathroom was nice and clean. Bed was fairly comfortable. Television had channels in a few different languages. Business center downstairs was free, so that was very nice. Don't think I had any major complaints about my stay.

Reviews.Title: “The location was the best thing about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: 987654321abc
Reviews.Content: Great location. Near enough to see the best of most tourist attractions within walking distance, with the ability to escape from all of the hustle and bustle when you need to sleep. Quite a small hotel. You definitely pay for the location rather than any facilities in the hotel. The staff are like any others in hotels, friendly but you'd expect that surely? Our room was "cleaned" every day. They gave it a bit of a tidy anyway. Fresh towels each day and a constant supply of toiletries. Ladies, I would recommend that you take your own hair dryer, regardless of the fact they say they have one. There is a terrible and pointless contraption in the bathroom which looks more like something you'd unblock a drain with and does nothing but blow out about as much hot air as a granny's fart... That aside, I'd recommend staying there purely because of where it is, but they certainly judge their prices based on that rather than anything else. Would not suggest it for families with small children. Best suited to couples or business.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location. Didn't like the beds.”
Reviews.Author: scoobydoobie
Reviews.Content: Hotel H10 Raco del Pi is terrifically located in the heart of the Barri Gotic on a street that is fairly busy during the day but absolutely dead quiet at night. It can be just a tad bit difficult to find the hotel again for the first time once you've made your initial journey out of it, but that's part of the beauty of staying there. The staff are very nice, the rooms are modern and clean, my only complaint with them was that the bed was not very comfortable to me. Were it not for the bed, I'd give the hotel five stars. One other thing, you have to pay an extra 2 euros per day if you want a key to use the safe in the room. Overall, this was a nice hotel in terms of location and qulaity of the room, other than it being just a little small (but perfectly adequate with a clean and updated bathroom too). The price was a bit high, not that the rooms aren't nice, but they definitely milk their location a little. I'd stay there again as a sure bet but I'd be interested for curiosity's sake to try someplace else next time in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ccsmyth
Reviews.Content: Barcelona, Hotel Rico del Pi May 15th-17th 2008 We absolutely loved this Hotel!!! Close to everything. We were in room 202, very large, clean and well appointed with a wonderful front view (balcony) and a jacuzzi tub!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, quiet”
Reviews.Author: lovebarcelonaUsa
Reviews.Content: Wife and I spent eight nights here. Greeted in the lobby with a free glass of spirits. Room and bath were adequate in size for two people, and very clean. Did not eat in the hotel's restaurant, though we did enjoy the daily, free fruits, nuts and other snacks from the lobby. There's also a small convenience store across the street from the front entrance which we took advantage of for a few late-night snacks. The hotel is a short walk from dozens of ancient Barcelona sites.

Reviews.Title: “Good all Rounder”
Reviews.Author: Waterloomoo
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two night stay at H10 Raco Del Pi. The hotel is very good, with efficient service.For being in a very central location I can't believe how tranquil the hotel was. Breakfast had a lovely continental spread with cheeses fruit pastries and bacon and eggs. During the afternoon 1pm to 9pm you could have complimentary tea,coffee and pastries in the bar. The rooms were small but had all the amenities that you need. The main thing was it was very clean. I have posted some photos of both the bedroom and the bathroom for you to make you own mind up. My score - 8/10 Would I use it again - yes.

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: Firethorne
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in the old part of Barcelona - narrow streets which is a bit tricky for taxis dropping you or picking you up at the hotel. You are in walking distance of Las Ramblas and the shops. The hotel was clean and tidy - nothing exceptional, but nicely appointed. We were offered a glass of sparkling wine on our arrival and hot drinks were available FOC throughout the day from the small bar area. Breakfast provided everything you needed, but the restaurant space was somewhat challenged!!! I would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a no nonsense place to stay in the city - clean, modern and 'there'!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: barbarakent
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and another couple have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. The location was great, just one street back from The Ramblas so nice and quiet, but just a short walk to any thing you could want, transport, resturants etc. The staff are really nice and helpful. The rooms were large (for a city hotel) and very clean. There were lovely touches like all the free toiletries and grooming products in the bathroom and even a shoe shine and needle kit in the wardrobe. Plus when you got back in the late afternoon exhausted from sightseeing there was free tea, coffee and pastries. The breakfast was very very good,cant think of anything that wasn't there, but very expensive (so have it on the 1st day when it is half price). All four of us would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Blundellsands
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in a great location, ideally situated just off La Rambla and less than 10 mins walk from Placa Catalunya where the airport bus stops! You are met with a welcome glass of Cava on arrival and there are coffee, water and cakes available all day free of charge, which is great after sightseeing! The breakfast was excellent both in choice and quality, there being both hot and cold dishes. The room we had was at the top of the hotel with a small window at floor level, but it was large and well appointed with a spa bath in the bathroom! There are plenty of restaurants nearby, but we found Barcelona generally more impersonal and expensive than other Spanish cities we have visited, and that includes Madrid! However, everything Gaudi is memorable, and if you like football a visit to Camp Nou is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointed!”
Reviews.Author: gingersmum
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after spending 3 nights at this hotel and we were very disappointed! As a result of reading some reviews, I took the trouble to email the hotel to explain that our visit was for a special occassion (our wedding anniversary) and please could we have one of the larger rooms at the front,overlooking the street.They completely ignored my letter and we were given a very small room at the back,with a view of a brick wall! I did go back to reception and they offered me the same room on another floor but with no windows!!(Although we had a window,the curtains were too narrow and there was a big gap down the middle so we were unable to make it dark...at least no one was able to see in due to being overlooked by the brick wall!) Our room was so small that we were unable to move around the bed at the same time ,so had to take it in turns to lie on the bed to enable the other to get ready.The bathroom was ok though except the shower sprayed the floor ,and all our stuff ,until we got used to it! On arrival we were offered the breakfast deal i.e.if you paid up front for all days you could have the first day half price.It was 16 Euros each! Expensive,but we decided that if we ate loads we wouldnt need to bother with lunch.This is what we did ,and it worked well.They also wanted us to pay in cash (for some reason their credit card machine was missing!) we refused as we didnt want to tie up E82 of our cash and guess what...the machine had reappeared the next morning!Very weird! As it is a buffet you can obviously pick and choose but if you are not fussy it was fine.There was : fruit juices,cereals,fresh fruit (lovely selection),cheeses,hams,smoked salmon,rolls,bread,yoghurts,croissants and a good selection of other pastries.Hot food was the same every day: scrambled egg,bacon,fried egg and sausage (the german kind).it was never very hot but was quite tasty. The free drinks and pastries in the foyer that others have mentioned are actually whats left from breakfast and usually ended up being croissants.There was never any hot water left to make tea so we managed with a cup of stewed coffee from an urn.But hey it was free! I have to say that everywhere was very clean and the staff were friendly enough.The position of this hotel is good for walking to lots of places although we felt very uneasy on the Ramblas and tried to avoid it as much as possible. To and from the airport we used the Aerobus which was great and really easy.4.05 Euros each,each way (tried to buy a return ticket but didnt seem possible).It drops you in Pl Catalunya and from there its about 10 min walk. A few other things I should mention: there is no lounge or bar in this hotel and they do not serve any other food apart from the breakfasts.There was free internet access in the foyer and also some newspapers available. Take earplugs as we were woken up at 3am every morning by people clattering down the hard floors and talking loudly!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: IrishTravellerDub
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights recently and was very pleased with our choice. The reviews on this site were spot on and the hotel did not disapoint. Our accomodation was fine, the beds were a bit on the firm side, but the bathroom was perfect. Our room overlooked the street and, unfortunately for us, some workmen started drilling right under our window at 9 a.m. on the Saturday morning - typical! The street probably hasn't been dug up in the last 50 years and we have to pick the one day. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel - at €15 a go, I just couldn't justify it. There's a really nice bakery/coffee shop just across the road to the left of the hotel and it's worth trying instead. One point, watch yourself in Barcelona. Three of our party of 12 were pickpocketed and there can be an uneasy air around the Ramblas at night. We never let any of our group walk alone at night. That aside, its a fantastic city and is really worth visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location, family friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Sadaal
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband and our 8 month old son stayed 4 nights in this really lovely intimate, clean hotel, with friendly staff. If you can afford this place it is worth it. For the best features was the location and our little balcony where we could sit and enjoy the street and enjoy the wiew of the Pi cantendral in the end of the street witha a glass of cava. The street was busy in day time and in the evening but at night it was totally empty and peacefull as there is no bars on the street just shops. Mind all the rooms have not got balconies or any view at all, so you should make sure to request it when you book the hotel. It was also really family friendly and the baby cot was good. Bathroom was spacefull and clean and the bath tub had a jacuzzyi feature. We got easely up to our floor with our baby buggy in the elevator. The brekfast buffet is fantastic with lots to choose from, and the staff really friendly and our litlle baby son got lots of positive attention. In our deal it was included in the room price but in general it coast 15 € per person per morning. The location could not bee better, with only a minutes stroll to wonderfull piazzas with many eateries both in and outside. The room had got all the required fasilities, TV, minibar, hairdryer and so on. I found this hotel trough this site, and agree with all the positive things that others have experienced. Might be that your search is over. The only bad thing is that we noticed that it is quite full booked, even in off season. So you should book well ahead or have good luck. There is only 37 rooms available. Family from Finland

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel , Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine-Martin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in Feb 2008. Lovely room with bath/shower etc and balcony overlooking the street outside. There was a bit of noise at night but nothing over obtrusive (tradesmen opening up premises etc). Very welcoming on arrival and very helpful desk staff. Not too sure the cava on arrival is really necessary but that's what they do and there's nothing wrong with that. We ate breakfast at the hotel as the street cafes didn't open till 10ish. However, hotel breakfast was fine and offered a good selection including continental, fresh fruit and english. Excellent location just off La Ramblas and only 10 minute walk to Place de Catalonia and to the seafront. Plenty of good quality restaurants within easy walking distance. Excellent small hotel - ideal for a short city break.

Reviews.Title: “24 - 27 Jan 2008”
Reviews.Author: MartHel
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the H10 Raco del Pi. We had a brilliant time in Barcelona and loved this hotel. We took ages to choose a hotel after reading numerous reviews and we were pleased with our choice. The hotel is tucked down a side street very close to Las Ramblas so in a brilliant location. We had complimentary cava on arrival and the complimentary coffee/tea and pastries provided throughout the day were great especially after a busy day out round the city. The staff on reception spoke very good English and were very helpful. We had room 407 on the 4th floor. It is on the back of the hotel so was lovely and quite but it only had two small skylights and a very small low level window (at ankle level!) so felt a bit dark. However it was clean and had everything we needed and to be honest you dont spend much time in the room so we didnt grumble. Looking at the floorplan on the back of our door we shall ask for room 402 next time which was much larger and had a balcony, but it it is on the front of the hotel so imagine it might be a bit noisy at night at busy times of the year. We would definitely recommend this hotel, particularly because of its position. We would also recommend using the aerobus to travel to and from the airport. It went from right outside the terminal to the centre at Placa de Catalyna and cost just 3.90 euros each. It runs every 15 mins even on Sundays and is less than a 10 min walk to the hotel. The hop on hop off Turistic bus is a must. The red tour round the north of the city was more interesting and we used it to get to and from the Nou Camp. For a lovely evening meal we would recommend Attic. A fab restaurant on Las Ramblas. Its above some shops about a third of the way down Las Ramblas. At night you cant miss it as you look up to see a modern and inviting restaurant overlooking the street with a queue of people waiting for tables! It was great to sit at the window watching the entertainers and people going by below whilst enjoying a lovely meal. It cost about 80 euros for a 3 course meal and a good bottle of wine. We loved it so much we went twice but would advise you to book a table or go before 8pm as there was always a queue after 8.30pm because its so popular. One word of warning - be careful about having a drink at the tables in the middle of Las Ramblas. We stopped for a rest and had 2 beers (not large ones) and they presented us with a bill for 15 euros! They charged us 7.50 euros each for a glass of San Miguel!! What a rip off - so ask the cost before you order. We absolutely loved Barcelona and will definitely return and stay at H10 Raco del Pi.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: gogogego
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over Christmas and it was excellent. You are greeted by very friendly staff (a glass of sparkling wine awaits) and the place is very stylishly decorated and clean. Our room was very nice - spacious with a skylight and a modern bathroom. The pastries and coffee that they provide are helpful when coming for an afternoon rest. Good bedding (high quality sheets, etc), hardwood floors and everything was very clean and presented well. The staff is very helpful and friendly, and it made our stay in Barcelona very pleasant. They were happy to provide us with a map, recommendations and allowed us to store our luggage for the day after we checked out. The location is also good if you don't mind a bit of bustle - it is in a shopping area, but it is relatively quiet and there are lots of good restaurants and bars nearby. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. For the price, it was incredible value.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Linda77
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very close to las ramblas and just round the corner from a great shopping street but is still quiet at night. our room was very large for a spanish hotel - with tons of wardrobe space and a sofa. the bathroom was very spacious with a full size bath and shower with nice mosaic tiles. the staff offered us cava on arrival and the hotel has a small intimate bar. the subway is not even mins walk, playa de catalunya not even 10 mins walk. all the hotels in barcelona seem to be at least this price or even higher so we were very pleased with our choice

Reviews.Title: “Free internet a bonus”
Reviews.Author: Travellerix
Reviews.Content: Absolutely superb. The free wireless internet was a real bonus as I am a writer and travelled with my laptop. Superb location near cathederal.rooms clean, staff friendly. highly reccomended

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: muffinboomer
Reviews.Content: We took a while to choose a hotel looking at reviews on trip advisor and finally booked on lastminuite.com.the location was great close to the Las Ramblas im a nice street that is safe at night. The room looks exactly like pictures shown the hotel website it was large in size as was bathroom very clean. breakfast was 16 euros hand a great seceltion of continental foods.if your a couple specify a king size bed as a standard double room comes with twins pushed together.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location.”
Reviews.Author: ScooterLondon
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, just off Las Ramblas. Fresh fruit in the lobby every day and sparkling wine upon arrival. The room we stayed in seemed to have just been redone, but it may have just been perfectly maintained! There was internet access in the bar area. Would recommend to anyone who wants a good location, a little luxury, but not huge price.

Reviews.Title: “H10, great location, clean with very hard beds!”
Reviews.Author: Justcruisin
Reviews.Content: Used Tobook.com to book this hotel and breakfast was not included. Beds were like sleeping on boards, but room was clean and hotel is in a great location. Only stayed one night pre-cruise so no big deal, but couldn't stand to sleep on those beds more than one night. Room was 101 a triple. Beware the triple is a fold out sofabed that will leave indentations on your body from the springs.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you make it so !”
Reviews.Author: nicholas40
Reviews.Content: Excellent location,clean,rooms a good average size(for a european!) The hotel is non smoking but someone had smoked in our room so we were promised a new one on the morning - this proved to be very small with a three quarters bed and it took a lot of 'discussion' with the manager before the honeymoon suite mysteriously became available ! After that,no problems and overall I would recommend it,but if you're unhappy with your room,stick to your guns. Forget the breakfast - there is a superb cafe only a few metres away with serves excellent pastries ,coffee etc at a fraction of the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Neat, clean and priced right”
Reviews.Author: JaLor
Reviews.Content: Good location for access to the Rambla, Cathedral and Gaudy. Hard to find since it is tucked away down one of the little side streets off a courtyard, but it all adds to the atmosphere of Barcelona. Don't count on your GPS since it is hard to pick up a signal among the buildings. The rooms are good size for Europe and more like N.American size. Clean with comfortable bed. Nice roomy clean washrooms with lots of hot water. Clean lobby, halls and stairways. The lift is a bit shakey and slow but works and can actually hold a few people. Don't count on the internet access since the desk staff can't figure out how to connect, although there seems to be access points on each floor. They still have one computer in lobby which is usually relatively easy to get on. Staff are very pleasant and eager to help (even if they can't). Speak English well and can always get there message across. Didn't eat in the hotel although they do have a morning breakfast. The area is very entertaining; lot's of hussle and bussel(particulary on the Saturday--but dead quiet on Sunday -- surprising!) and many places to eat. Just sit on the Rambla and have a nice tall cold beer and watch the activity. Cathedral is a short walk away and Gaudy can be reached on foot but will take about 15-20 mins. Metro nearby but I would recommend a taxi if coming in from the airport for about 20euro. If going to Port Vell another 20e (special fees to port + luggage charges). Sorry, no pictures of hotel since all have me in them struggling to get the internet connection!

Reviews.Title: “On a city break ? Stay here.”
Reviews.Author: SHJ199
Reviews.Content: So you're planning a city break to Barcelona ? Never been before? You're reading all of the reviews but can't decide where to stay ? When you don't know the city at all, it's so confusing having to weigh up the various permutations and options. After all, you want to enjoy the trip, not be let down by a bad choice of hotel, right ? I had the same difficulties, but am very glad that I opted for the Raco del Pi. If you want roof-top pools, plush facilities or funky interiors to relax in whilst visiting a great city, this hotel is not for you. However, if you want a clean, comfortable and friendly base for exploring the delights of the city on a long weekend, with little time to waste, Raco del Pi will suit you perfectly. Previous reviewers have not lied. The location is absolutely PERFECT (in the heart of the gothic quarter). The discreet entrance is on a pedestrian only street (though taxis can pick-up / drop off at the door). The Cathedral is only a moment’s stroll away. In the opposite direction Las Ramblas is no further. Shops and cafes abound. Similarly, the waterfront area, museums and main central tourist sties can all be easily reached on foot from the front door. This truly is a central location. We booked a standard double room just one week before our 3 night trip. The only request I made was for it to be non-smoking. We were greeted by a friendly “Hola”, a glass of Cava and a front facing room of ample size on the first floor, with a balcony view of the street below. The bathroom (with customary toiletries) was large enough for a bidet. Both rooms were spotlessly clean and a room safe allowed us to store valuables. The beds are firm but very comfortable and the air conditioning can be easily controlled by a wall thermostat. The rate was for a room only, but we welcomed not being “tied in” to breakfast in the hotel (though it was extensive and a 50% discount was offered for the first morning). English newspapers lay on a table for guests to read. If you prefer, there is a very pleasant coffee shop 10yds up the street serving a wide selection of pastries or a pretty church square 50yds the other way with two cafes. We were happy to mix it up. All of the staff are very friendly and helpful. Complimentary tea, coffee and pastries are available every afternoon and the free Internet is also available for guest use. If you have a late departure, the hotel will gladly store your cases after check-out so you can enjoy the last few hours in the city. We both enjoy staying in more opulent hotels, but on a city break with so much to offer, the amount of time spent in them doesn’t justify their cost. Not once did we regret booking this hotel. You can waste your time looking at more options if you want to, but at the Raco del Pi you won’t be wasting any time in Barcelona…!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Raco Del Pi and Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: lassieshropshire
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at the Raco Del Pi with my family. Rooms although not very large were spotless. The staff couldn't have been more freindly and the buffett breakfast excellannt. The position is ideal for exploring Barcelona and very close to pretty squares, shops & resturants as well as the pick up point for the Bus Touristic. With what I consider to be very reasonable rates I wouldn't hesitate to recomend this hotel amd will deffinatley use it again as I can't wait to return to Barcellona.

Reviews.Title: “Good, central Barcelona hotel”
Reviews.Author: WalesTraveller
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. It is in an excellent location, not far from the Ramblas (and hence the Metro station) as well as the Gothic quarter, the Cathedral etc. There are plenty of bars and restaurants close by. As many others have said, the rooms are fairly small and although not spectacularly decorated, they are adequate and clean. The bathroom was quite a good size though. There is a little atrium courtyard in the middle of the hotel which is nice to relax in and read a book after a busy day in Barcelona. One downside to this hotel is that there is only one (tiny) lift which is incredibly slow and you have to wait a while for it come! Many times we just gave up! The reception staff were very friendly and welcoming, especially with the free glass of cava on arrival! The free tea/ coffee/ croissants etc during the day was also a nice touch, as well as free internet access if you need it. The breakfast was included in the price of our stay and it was pretty decent. Overall we thought this hotel was quite good value for money considering its central location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: carbs47
Reviews.Content: Just returned from wonderful 4 day break at the Raco del Pi and just cannot find fault with any part of our stay at all. The location of the hotel is second to none - nestled in the very heart of the gothic area, close to shops, las ramblas and catalunya square. I had booked the room directly with the hotel, and emailed a request for a larger room after reading some of the reviews here - we were allocated a larger, corner room at the front of the hotel (304). Whilst the room wasn't huge, it was certainly more generous than some of the other rooms towards the back of the hotel that we peeked into when the maid was cleaning. The room also had two small balconies, one overlooking the pedestrian street (great for people watching with a glass of cava) and the other overlooking a quiet service alley, it was great to open the doors just to soak up the murmur of the street below, without the noise becoming intrusive. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel, but we did enjoy the complimentary coffee and pastries which were always fresh and a welcoming after a long day (or night) out. The hotel staff were also very friendly, offering advice and personal recommendations. Highly recommend this hotel - book direct for best rooms (appx €442 for 3 nights) .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Patreras
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for its location, accomodations and service. The front desk was so friendly at check in. How can you go wrong with a cold glass of cava? They booked tours, recommended restaurants, made reservations and called a taxi when we left. The rooms were small, like most of Europe, but had two french doors for great air and ambiance. The hotel is right off Plaza Pi which hosted both an art show and a gourmet foods market during our stay. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Pottandcrock
Reviews.Content: Quite possibly the worst hotel I have stayed in - our room was on the top floor with no windows except for two recessed skylights letting very little light. Plug sockets hanging off the wall, very uncomfortable bed and tiny bathroom. Only positives were the service - very friendly staff - and the location, right in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: bubble23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raco del Pi for 4 wonderful nights and found it to be exactly as people had described - fantastic! The location can't be beaten, right in the heart of everything, with tapas bars, restaurants, sights and local transport links all within a stones throw. The Ramblas is about a 10 minute walk away, with loads of little squares and alfresco bars to quench your thirst along the way! Just as people have said, it is really quiet at night and the hotel's airconditioning is fab. Yes the rooms are small, but to be honest, the cleanliness, location and staff make up for it. We didn't have the breaksfast, as we weren't staying on a B&B basis, and it was really expensive (about 15 euros) per person, but there were loads of little places just outside so there was no problem. It did look great though so if you get a deal including breakfast then go for it! The only negative that we found with the location, and it is really minor, is that when the shutters go down, it is quite tricky to navigate your way back through the little winding streets to find the hotel, as all the streets look the same. It took us a few days of trundling around late at night to get our bearings in the dark, which was fun, after a few sangrias, but a little scary if you're alone i would imagine! Also, although the cleanliness of the streets has been mentioned, their methods haven't! As a youngish girl (!) with a penchant for high heals, and a tendancy to get very sore feet late in the evening, I was quite surprised by the ritual spraying of the streets from about 1:30 in the morning onwards. I have normally kicked my heels off by this point, but I learnt my lesson pretty quickly after the 3rd night of slimy and rather yucky feet, to plan ahead and either not wear shoes that will need kicking off, or avoid the sprayers - tricky when they spray the whole of the Ramblas and gothic quarter! Not a complaint in the slightest, but something I wish I had been aware of before going out on the raz!! I would definitely go back to Raco del Pi, and would recommend it to anyone wishing to visit the grogeous Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: curiousgadgy
Reviews.Content: This hotel ticks all the boxes, perfect location, right at the centre yet just far enough away from the noise, thouroughly cleaned each day, air conditioning that works etc etc. It is a small friendly hotel with everything you need to provide a home from home and the staff are all extremely professional and helpful especially the multilingual Yannika who gave fantastic assistance when I had my wallet removed by a proffesional thief on the Metro. 3 bits of advice for Barcelona visitors, avoid the metro, have breakfast included in the price (sorry but 16 euros is too much) and stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: beekay458
Reviews.Content: The H10 Raco del Pi is well-located in the "Gothic Quarter" of BCLN. You just walk out of your front door and you are in the thick of stores, tapas bars, and the beauty of BCLN streetlife. (BCLN is one of the cleanest big cities I have ever visited. They obviously spend a lot of money on keeping their city clean.) Despite the busy location, street noise was not a factor. The H10 is a smallish boutique hotel. It is meticulously clean although, as others have mentioned, the rooms are definitely small. We did not have a computer along and but a guest did complain to me about the WIFI signal. There was a free public computer with printer available for guest use. Mineral water and small snacks are available in the bar. There is a beautiful courtyard in the center of the building which we enjoyed using. The beds were hard but comfortable. The AC worked but not to the degree that one of our friends would have liked. The breakfast, although expensive, was very extensive and filling.

Reviews.Title: “Top location, not bad little hotel”
Reviews.Author: 3dodos
Reviews.Content: The Raco Del Pi excelled in the following areas, location (just off the Ramblas) but in a little street which is busy by day and pleasantly quiet by night, the cleanliness of the rooms were out-standing and well kitted out with useful nick-nacks, however it was somewhat let down by the pretty small rooms (205) the bathroom was particularly small. The other point worth a mention is that the walls are not very well sound insulated :-( Apart from that not bad value for money with the free tea/croissants etc whenever you're alittle peckish.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: earthtomark
Reviews.Content: Nice place. Staff was friendly, in the limited time that I spoke to them. I tend to be a pretty self sufficient traveler. I am a little torn on the area however. A friend stayed just a few hundred meters away in a hotel on Via Laitana, which was a much easier place to get to...and find. The area that this hotel is in, is a warren of ancient streets, that at night, after drinks, becomes very diffcult to navigate. However the last night I spent in BCN, late at night I had the whole Barri Gothic to myself, and as I wandered around it was so peaceful it made the whole thing worth it. Since I'm a man and less likely to get hassled, it worked for me, but for women it *may* be different. I suppose it would depend on your level of comfort/street sense.

Reviews.Title: “Definitly worth it!”
Reviews.Author: cmarcel78
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel!! In the middle of everything, but also quiet when you want to get some sleep. I shared the room with 2 other people and the space was ample!! We got room 201 and the ceiling was so high and the room spacious. The bathroom was really pretty with the mosaic tiles in deep blue, with double sinks! (There was also a scale, but why depress yourself when you're on vacation). We also had a small balcony that overlooked the walkable street. Didn't take advantage of the breakfast b/c we only stayed 2 nights. But they do offer free coffee and water throughout the day and nuts to snack on. The staff was very helpful and nice. Especially, Albert. He was the best throughout my whole week in Spain. I recommend this place to those who want to be in the middle of action, but also on a quieter street. La Ramblas was 2 turns/ 2 min walk away (where all the loudness and madness is). I don't recommend staying on that street unless you plan not to get any sleep or don't want to relax. Also, the subway was close by as well as walking distance to Playa de Catalunya. This is in the heart of the Gothic quarter and I really did enjoy my stay here.Would either stay here or another H10 hotel when I return to Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: RichardSomerset
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short break staying at the Raco del Pi in the Barri Gothic, Barcelona. The hotel was excellent - friendly staff, glass of cava on arrival, lovely modern room with balcony overlooking the street of Barri Gothic close to the cathedral. Superb breakfast with variety of fresh fruits, cereals, yoghurt, cheeses, cold meats, bacon & egg. Great location for shops, bars, restaurants and also to La Rambla and Placa Catalunya. Liceu metro is close at hand. Recommend the orange tourist bus (the uofficial one) which takes you on a circuit around all the city's main tourist attractions for 20 euros - you can get on and off as you wish which takes about 2 hours to do the full circuit ( the official red and blue buses cost 19 euros and do a half circuit of the city). You also get discount vouchers to attractions like the Poble Espanyol and La Pedrera. Recommend the restaurants "Pla de Garsa", C/Assoanadors (Catalunyan dishes); "Les Quinze Nits" in Placa Real (it opens at 8.30pm and you need to queue - extremely good value for money (3 course meal with litre of house wine for 4 people 74 euros!), "Sinatra restaurant" in C/Heures - nouvelle cuisine so order extra potatoes! Must see - the locals dancing the Sardana in front of the Cathedral 6.30pm on Saturdays (and I think at midday on Sundays) and La Pedrera (Casa Mila) - go up onto the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shoegalep
Reviews.Content: The location is second to none. Staff pleasent and the free coffee is nice. However This was the smallest room I have ever stayed in and just in case you think that it my first trip to Europe....Wrong more like my 10th. The room was clean but that bed was so uncomfortable and the room so small even with the great location I would pass next time I am Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Did the Job”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravellerIre
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a 4 night stay at the Raco del Pi. The first thing I would say is that the location is amazing, off the Ramblas and in a lovely quiet street in the Gothic Quarter. We couldnt possibly fault the location. The hotel is pretty nice, a lovely exterior and very friendly front desk staff. However the hotel room was average. I found all the dark wood quite gloomy and the room was tiny. It was however very clean and well serviced. Positives: LOCATION, powerful shower, fresh flowers in the bathroom, free drinks and pastries all day in the bar, very nice front desk staff, free tolietries in the bathroom, good air con in the room, nice comfy bed Negatives: Quite gloomy bedroom interior, no view from the room (207), slightly grubby tiles in the shower Overall, if you get this hotel at a good price I would say go for it! The location is spot on!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel added to our stay”
Reviews.Author: LiamN_Ireland
