Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel from the 20th May for 4 nights and we found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. There was a very good selection of food for breakfast and also a small tea coffie area where you could help yourself free of charge throught the day up to bed time. The rooms were not the largest but they were quite adaquet and very clean and modern.The location of the hotel is very good and quiet. We will uyse this hotel again when we return to see the many sight that we did not manage to visit . Summing up ,three star hotel with four star attention. W McKay .Ballymena. N.Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny (!) rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mirch
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the hotel after reading the reviews here, and I must say we were very surprised. The hotel is indeed well located, and has very nice and helpful staff, but...the rooms are so tiny that we couldn't even open our suitcase. We've asked the front desk to be moved to a bigger room, but they said that our room was one of the biggest in the hotel. Since we did want to open our suitcase and to be able to move around the room, after staying there for the first night, we moved to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: maggieOxford
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed 4 nights in this centrally located, quiet, comfortable and clean hotel. The room was a bit small, but we didn't spend much time in it. The bathroom was a good size with a good shower. There were flowers in the room. The staff were very welcoming, friendly and spoke good English. The breakfast was included and was excellent with a wide choice. A very nice suprise was the tea, coffee, croissants and cakes served free all day at the bar and the free internet access. We thought it was good value for money and would stay there again. As 2 women travelling together we found it secure and we felt safe. The location is very good, near the old cathedral, not far from a metro, but far enough from the Ramblas not to be noisy. The street opened into a lovely square with a church that held concerts and a farmers' market.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeilaA
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. First off, it's location is unbeatable. It's central to everything, but it's on a quiet and winding beautiful little street , right next to Santa Maria del Pi. In fact, the church can be seen from some of the hotel's balconies. In addition, the place was spotless, the rooms were modern, and the service was great. All of the staff was extremely friendly and very courteous. I will definitely stay here during my next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lival
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent locaion, close to all amenities, lovely breakfast, complimentary internet, lovely toiletries, would definitely use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Shady Alleys (Don't Trust the Cabs) But a Honeyed Gem in the Tough”
Reviews.Author: LaChingona
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute, using Tripadvisor's links to venere.com. Thank GOD - although our cab driver didn't know where it was and we had to navigate the deliciously creepy alleys at night looking like complete Yankee tourists (yes, lots of heroin users, no, they didn't bother us), once we got there, it was like heaven. We arrived very early in the morning, around 6 am, and had to wait to check in, but luckily, they let us drop our bags off while we toured the city. They have delicious free breakfast and free internet! And once we arrived for real, we got a free glass of cava too! H10 Raco Del Pi is a glimmering oasis of calm and modernism in the gritty urban center of Barcelona. It's a stone's throw from the Ramblas and in the middle of the amazing Barri Gotic - full of small alleys and surprising plazas, home to some fanastic shopping. And you MUST try Juicy Jones, a short walk away, for the freshest tasting juices of your life.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mattbutt
Reviews.Content: Ok hotel, good location If a bit noisy but that is what you get if you stay in a city centre hotel. Dont expect to get any sleep during the day up till about 10pm if you have a room at the front, you will probably also be woken by street cleaning and people walking home late at night but, its very well located. One thing, room was clean, but we did find a cockroach on our last night. Not too familiar with them, but I assume you get them in old buildings? It was only one and was thrown out the window and didnt see anyothers. The Shower Screen didnt fit the bath so water went everywhere. Im only giving it 3 out of 5, as it was nice, but not that cheap for a 3* bit noisy but well located. Im sure you can find better for not much more cash.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dowe&Dumples
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel quite average for the price but the location was excellent. It was very close to the Ramblas and very easy to get to all areas of the Gothic Quarter and the very trendy Ravel - well worth a visit for bars and restaurants. The room was small and we had a view of a wall. The air conditioning didn't work although the the window did open so you could get some fresh air, although it was noisy outside. The bathroom was nicely decorated. I'm sure that there were probably better rooms than ours but we booked through Expedia so we didn't have an option of choosing the room. This may be something worth considering when you are booking the hotel. We didn't have the breakfast at the hotel but there is a great bakery opposite the hotel where you can grab something to eat. If you aren't going to spend much time in the hotel and you want something clean and functional with a great location then this hotel will suit your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: shanecon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a ,loose the kids' weekend with my wife at the the Raco del Pi and can say I found it to be an excellent Hotel and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to friends. We booked the hotel after reading reviews on this site and found nearly all the positive to be true, the negatives? well you can't please everyone. The cava on arrival and free cakes & coffee in the afternoon were nice little touches, but don't book because of them. Just step out of your hotels door and walk a hundred metres in any direction and you'll be spoilt for choice on alternative refreshments. the hotel is clean, modern and reasonably priced. But this hotels major asset is it's location, everything in the heart of this wonderful city is right there on your doorstep. we'll be back, soon I hope.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: keentoseetuscany
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel in early February. The location is superb - a minute's walk from La Rambla and about 5-10 mins from the Aerobus stop. The staff were very friendly and we were offered a glass of (very delicious!) cava on arrival. The room was modern and spotless. The bathroom had two washhand basins and a huge array of toiletries including a shaving kit and combs! From reading previous reviews we decided to skip breakfast in the hotel as it was too expensive, however we were offered breakfast on the first morning at a special 50% rate. That was worth it as there is a good selection to choose from. This hotel is situated in the old part of the city and is surrounded by lots of interesting little shops and cafes. If any girls reading this are into jewellery making (as I am) there is an excellent bead shop right beside the hotel. There are several more in the vicinity but some of them are trade only and in some you have to buy a set minimum number of beads. On a practical note the Aerobus is the cheapest way to get from the airport, and very straightforward. Also, as with all cities, stopping for a coffee or snack on La Rambla will be much more expensive than heading off the main street. The food market just off La Rambla is worth going to even if you are just looking! It also has lots of little tapas establishments (counters/stalls) which are packed with locals.

Reviews.Title: “Just another average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JAMMY2007
Reviews.Content: We arrived @10pm and were offered a glass of cava which was a nice start. The receptionist then led us to the room which smelt badly of smoke. I had put in the booking notes we wanted a non-smoking room. We were given a different room which was fine but there were ash trays present so we assumed it was still a smoking room but it was fresh and clean so we took it. During the night it was apparent the air con did not work and the room was stuffy and warm, when I opened the window noise from the alley below was annoying so we closed it again. I point this out as it could be a problem in the summer when the weather gets hot. Otherwise room was clean and bathroom nice although the room was quite small. Maids did a nice job too. The free internet use is useful and the free coffee/tea and cakes is a nice touch. The nearby Duc De La Victoria in which we stayed on our last visit to Barcelona in my opinion is a far superior Hotel. Yes the Raco Del Pi has a great location and some nice touches but thats about it I'm afraid. Average.

Reviews.Title: “We were very disappointed in the Raco Del Pi”
Reviews.Author: lily8
Reviews.Content: Having booked and confirmed the Raco Del Pi months in advance we were appalled to find that they had given our room to someone else - although at first they said it was 'a flood in the room' - as we arrived at 6pm, tired from our flight. They then asked us to wheel our suitcases a few blocks to another hotel (The Duc del la Victoria), and requested we come back the next day after 12pm (check-out time). We came back and were given a tiny room at the front of the hotel on the second floor which was incredibly noisy as the street is a pedestrian thoroughfare. We requested a quieter room and were moved to the rear first floor to be woken at 6am after an uncomfortable sleep by the sound of crashing pots and pans - we were above the kitchen! We decided then to go back to the Duc de la Victoria which for the same price had much larger rooms, a really comfortable bed with a proper sprung matress, and a big beautiful bathroom. We also had a big terrace balcony overlooking the bari gotic. The difference in quality of these two hotels was amazing, and i don't understand how the Raco Del Pi is rated 4 star. The rooms are old and tired and small, and the beds thin old traditional unsprung matresses - hopeless for dodgy backs.

Reviews.Title: “Raco del Pi: Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Flower1783
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, clean, large room, very helpful and friendy staff, excellent central location in gothic quarter, cava on arrival...we couldn't have asked for anything more! (However do not take the hotel's restaurant recommendation...it was incredibly overpriced and there are many much better options in the immediate locality.) Highly recommend Irati restaurant and Taller de Tapas (in del Pi square), visit to Cathedral Roof, Park Guell and La Pedreda etc, the Perfume museum, Picasso Museum, Castle Montjuic, the Zoo, the Olympic park..and the cafe in the textile museum and the bar 'Bosc des Fades'.. Have a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Magic Short Break”
Reviews.Author: Alanormerod
Reviews.Content: First class hotel. Staff excellent. Rooms are great and the bathroom had every conceivable item you could wish for, you only need to take personal perfume/aftershave. The hotel position could not have been better, right in the heart of the Gothic area and close to The Rambla. Favourite restaurant was in Place Reial just off Rambla, be prepared to queue for 8.30pm opening but believe me its worth the wait for food/location/price. A must is the official tour bus, must do the Blue and Red routes you can get on and off them when you want best 23euros we spent for two days travel.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: over60EastKilbride
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend break in Barcelona. The hotel was excellent. The staff very friendly and helpful. Our room was at the front of the hotel and had a small balcony overlooking the quaint street. The room was very clean and the extra touches like toiletries and fresh flowers were perfect. The mini bar was well stocked and replenished daily. We had paid for bed and breakfast and the breakfast was excellent with a great choice. The coffee, tea, water and pastries supplied free of charge each day were most appreciated. The hotel is very near la Ramblas but far enough away to be quieter. If we were going back to Barcelona, we would definitely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: JBLEAR
Reviews.Content: This welcoming hotel was within easy walking distance of the Placa de Catalunya, in the middle of a warren of streets which were stuffed with bars, restaurants and shops. Not far from Las Ramblas, although I didn't rate Las Ramblas at all. Our location was far better. The location was ideal, quiet, but within minutes of busier streets. Our room was at the side of the hotel (room 107). Good size, lovely and clean - no view, but that wasn't a problem at all. Loads of goodies in the bathroom - even a toothbrush kit is provided - a first for me ! Fresh flowers as well which was a nice touch. The staff were very friendly. Particularly welcome was the tea, coffee and water and cakes that were left on the bar in the afternoon and evening. Very nice when you were coming back to the hotel after a walk out ! Complimentary papers and internet access were also in the bar area as well. There was a lovely open courtyard in the middle of the bar area which would be lovely in warmer weather. I would recommend this hotel for it's great location and nice little extras that you don't often get. We got it at a very reasonable price so it was excellent value for money as well.

Reviews.Title: “A gothic gem”
Reviews.Author: B-Grrrrl
Reviews.Content: Tucked away in the narrow streets of the atmospheric Gothic Quarter, this is a perfect location - away from the hustle and bustle, yet only a 2 minute walk from Las Ramblas, 5 minutes to Placa de Catalunya and 25 minutes to Casa Mila (La Pedrera) if you would rather soak up a little of the atmosphere of the Gracia area instead of jump on a corwded tourist bus. The staff were friendly, the rooms were clean, the mini bar not that expensive. I took my parents (mid 60's) an my other half (30 something) and we all had a terrific time. I would definitely stay at the Raco del Pi again.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't disappoint”
Reviews.Author: BigAl9
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay , we chose the hotel from the reveiw s on trip advisor and it didn't disappoint us. Begining with the use of the Aerobus, short walk to the hotel, chilled Cava on arrival and giving my party 2 rooms adjacent with balconies overlooking the lovely old Gothic Quarter, we were not let down. Breakfast was included and was lovely lots of choice of fresh fruit, meats, cheese and cakes, small cooked selection (the CornFlakes however were a little strange) We made use of the complimentary tea, coffee and the internet access all lovely touches making the hotel special. We loved the position very central and the Bus Turista was brilliant, we couldn't fault the hotel and would definately stay here again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it, Art, Football and Shops what more could you want.

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel and city but be careful...”
Reviews.Author: rosiekwacker
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the basis of reviews on Trip Advisor so felt I had to have my say!! Took my mum to Barcelona for 3 nights to celebrate her 70th birthday so was looking for a central hotel - not too expensive. This hotel is very centrally located - ideal for shopping and exploring the Ramblas. The rooms are clean (if a little too warm and as we were on the first floor over looking the terrace we couldn't open our window) and ours was a nice size with a large bathroom. Majority of the staff were nice and helpful although we were not offered a glass of cava when we arrived - even though it was on the reception desk and I didn't have the guts to ask for it!! Only fault I found with this hotel was the noise level - be warned - bring ear plugs. Regardless of where your room is within the building you will have some noise - because it is located in a pedestrianised shopping district you won't have much traffice noise but you will hear the local church bells, shoppers and late night partiers and also within the hotel, the rooms and corridors are tiled which means that foots steps etc. are quite loud. Also, some rooms are located right next to the lift and stair well which can also be noisy. Aside from that I would highly recommend this hotel - price and comfort could not be beaten and the choice of breakfast in the morning was huge (this was included in our package). Only major downside of our weekend was the fact that my purse was stolen from my handbag - I still have no idea how they got it but when I returned to the hotel after dinner on our last night it was gone. Luckily I had only the bare essentials in it but still - it was a shock to find it gone. I'd like to pride myself on being savvy when it comes to this kind of thing but they are utter professionals - so make use of the safe in your room (only 2 Euro a night) and ensure you use a back pack that is zipped up and has two straps - and preferably keep it to your front. Stay to well lit areas at night and be smart. Barcelona is a fabulous place and I would return again tommorrow but I'd be wiser next time when it comes to personal security.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pinchy
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here last week for 3 nights, I have to agree with the other reviews, we didn't bother with a taxi and just got the aerobus from the airport, (3 euros 75) which dropped us off at Plaza Catalunya, and the hotel was about 5 minutes or so away. Again, agree with the checking in, we were offered a glass of cava which was really nice. The free tea, coffee etc are available after 1pm, and run all night., there are only about 3 tables to sit at, so could be a squash if a few people wanted to sit there. We had the breakfast there, which was fine at 50% discount at 7 euros each. We went to Mikos on Las Ramblas the other mornings, and you could get an 'american breakfast' with with coffee for 6 euros 20, but we tried the traditional type,(same price) bread with tomato rubbed on it with serrano ham and cheese, with fresh orange and coffee. I agree about the church bells, it was quite warm when we were there, and I asked at reception about the air con, as there didn't appear to be any, but it is typical Spain, they can't understand why we want to be cold in the winter! We ended up opening the window, so could hear the bells, which didn't bother us too much during the night, but you could really hear them about 8am or 9am. Our bath was very small, I'm 5'2" and I couldn't lie down in it! Nevertheless, everything was nice and clean and in good repair. Again, agree Taller de Tapas was quite expensive, it was good quality, but quite small portions. We ordered clams and beans, which cost nearly 7 euros, and we counted 6 small clams! Good service and good wine though. Excellent location!

Reviews.Title: “Not Just pick pockets”
Reviews.Author: LuckyduckBristol
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel fine for the price, great location and agree with comments from other users. We were given a sheet from the hotel warning of the types of ways people would steal from you. We have a new one to add. Walking to Gaudi's cathedral we were asked by a man who was looking at a map if we could show him where he was. As we tried to help two burly men came and identified themselves as policemen, said there was counterfeit money around and asked for passports and wallets. The lost stooge produced his and was given them back. It didn't feel right so I refused and asked to see their identification which they had flashed at the start very quickly. They then waved us on. Be careful

Reviews.Title: “Totally fabulous-no complaints”
Reviews.Author: Bloors
Reviews.Content: We did the 0.1p ryanair thing and got into Girona early, bought our return tickets for the bus (from inside the arrivals hall), 21 euros return, as opposed to the 120 euros one way as quoted by a taxi driver !! It takes about an hour but takes you direct to the north bus station in Barcelona,( follow the signs to the exit and there's plenty of awaiting taxis). Asked for a price to the hotel, our driver didn't know of it , which gave us cause for concern, he got on his radio and convinced us he knew the way , the price he indicated was in between 5-10 euros. We got dropped off halfway down Las Ramblas and he told us that he couldn't drive direct to the hotel, but 5 mins later we had found it.The price ended up at 7 euros, not bad at all. The little walk to the hotel quickly put any doubts to the back of our mind as we were presented with the most quaint alleyways, shops, buildings and an electric atmosphere from the tourists. We spotted the doorway of the hotel and proceeded to check in. At this point i will tell you we had booked the room all on the net via spain bookers, we had asked if possible for an upgrade as we were celebrating our wedding anniversay- TRUE !! We were offered a glass of cold cava whilst the receptionist checked us in, he also told us our room was large with a balcony, splendid . We got to our room (102) and it was big, 2 twin beds pushed together, co-ordinating soft furnishing, tv, fully stocked mini bar, fully tiled bathroom with spa bath, shower and the biggest array of freebies i've ever seen. We proceeded to our balcony and were gob smacked, we had prime position looking down onto the gothic quarter. We were really pleased. We dumped our bags and went exploring, if you turn left out of reception your mins away from playca de catalunya, the major central point, along the way you can go via the small streets of head up las ramblas. Turn right and your heading towards the port again via the little streets. Las ramblas has bars and restaurants along it and all the street entertainment, some x rated nearer to the bottom end. We ate in The Attic and it was amazing and not over priced at all, in fact for 2 people 2 courses plus wine it was 53 euros, well worth it. We also had an indian meal at the Raaj, food was nice , service a bit slow but for 23 euros what can you expect? Barcelona is gorgeous, clean and very efficient. Biggest tip is to get the tickets for Nou Camp tour well worth it, also the bus turistica is brill for getting you from a to b it has 2 routes and you can mix and match with just one priced ticket, 18 euros for the day, it goes everywhere you'd need to see, and has tour guide speaking in english too. I could go on and on about Barcelona, but i'm talking about the hotel !! Take breakfast at 50% discount on the 1st morning its well worth it, really good choice hot and cold but i suppose at 14 euros its expensive. On both nights we helped ourselves to free tea and coffee at the bar and also took the water to our room. You'll not be dissapointed and if you are then book the Hilton, but you wouldn't get the character and atmosphere of this wonderful location and brill hotel, enjoy your trip, we did and wil be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, bad beds”
Reviews.Author: baltorich
Reviews.Content: You can't get a better location right in a pedestrian zone in the heart of Barcelona. The room was quite spacious and the bath, featuring a jacuzzi tub, was huge. We had a room with a balcony overlooking the busy shopping street but the doors did a good job of blocking out most of the noise (if you're noise sensitive though, you don't want a room facing the street). I would've given it 4 stars but the beds are atrocious. I asked for a double bed for two but got the old-school european separate twins that were made separately and pushed together. Even worse were the mattresses which were really very uncomfortable. I can sleep on almost anything but still woke up every morning in pain because the thin mattress was like a rock. The people at reception were very friendly, and it was nice that they regularly provided drinks, snacks and internet usage. Take their security warnings seriously. At 2 in the morning on the second night were were woken up by loud screams from the street where a man walking alone had been mugged and pushed to the ground - literally right in front of the hotel. It's not that the hotel is in a bad area (just the opposite really), but that muggers know that tourists wandering the streets at that hour are easy prey. We took advantage of the first morning 50% off breakfast which was good, but it's definitely not worth the regular 15 euro they charge if it's not included in your room. The only reason I wouldn't stay here again is the beds. They just don't give you the comfort you need after playing tourist all day and night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wirralmember
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Raco Del Pi 12 months ago and, having enjoyed our stay, decided to return this year. We weren't disappointed. We asked for a room over the street on the booking form and got a large 2nd floor room with a small balcony. There was a well stocked mini bar and in the bathroom theres just about every toiletry you need, even a passable cologne. Theres lots nice homely touches, like free internet access, complementary fruit, snacks and coffee, and the staff are friendly and helpful. All those we dealt with spoke perfect English. For a weekend break the location couldn't be better, 5 minutes from the Aerobus in Placa Catalunya and smack in the middle of the Gothic quarter. Carrer Del Pi is a pedestrian street so theres little noise to bother you at night, and theres a nice cafe in the square 50 yards away if you'd rather head out for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very central, very clean”
Reviews.Author: purpleboots
Reviews.Content: We booked on the strength of Tripadvisor reviews so better report back! very central, really easy to get in and out of and mercifully just out of reach of the Ramblas. All the usual 4* stuff, but very basic. We'd booked a twin and got two beds shoved up against each other (easy to move but irritating). Agree with other reviewers that the rooms are small but thanks to imaginative architecture, even the inside ones are light. Very nice to see free internet - no-one mentioned that there was complementary coffee and cake or that there is also a library of books (on the third floor). Staff were good, I'd stay there again and can see it being great if you're there for business but not my idea of a place for romance

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel - in particular single rooms!”
Reviews.Author: jypdc
Reviews.Content: A friend and I booked two single rooms here this past weekend. We were extremely dissatistifed with the rooms and left to find other accomodations. Upon our departure, the hotel threatened that they'd called the police because we refused to resubmit our credit card information (which the hotel already had through our booking on Venere). I would strongly suggest avoiding this hotel! More details on our experience follow. The single rooms are extremely small (think storage closet), but much worse than size, the singles are located next to the elevator. The head of the bed is located right next to the elevator shaft - not even across the room! The walls are so thin that we could not only hear the elevator but could also feel the vibrations. A major design flaw! We requested another room - any other room. However, the hotel was fully booked. We asked for a room at another H10 hotel (there are several properties in Barcelona), but there was only one room available at one of the other H10 properties. We were told that we could have that room, but would still have to pay the late cancellation fee of one night for the single rooms that we found unacceptable. I know of no other hotel that would charge a cancellation fee if a guest merely transfers to another property. We called around and found another hotel (non-H10) that was nearby and had 2 rooms available. Upon our departure, the hotel manager on duty told us that we needed to resubmit our credit card so that he could charge us for one night - essentially as "no shows". We refused, saying that he already had our credit card information through our booking on Venere. We questioned why he would need the information again. An hour or so later, my friend received a threatening call on her mobile from the hotel manager that he had reported us to the police. The threat appeared to be false, as we were never contacted by the police during our stay in Barcelona. However, I found this hotel to be unreasonable in its policies, and unprofessional in its threats.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: angel84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Raco from the 20th to 24th November with my sister and mum so age range 22 to 57.First things first, the hotel was great, good location, clean and well presented. Upon arrival, staff were helpful and accomodating - we were given our free glass of Cava and shown around the hotel ammenities, free internet access was great for me and free pastries, coffee and tea served during the day. The hotel did have some downfalls, my sister was given a box room with a skylight for the same price as the double I shared with my mum - which was booked as a twin. The smaller room had a constant dripping noise which no engineer seemed to be able to sort out but in all honesty, these factors did little to discourage my overall impression of the place. The rooms were clean and well stocked with shampoo's, bath gels, shower caps etc which were replenished every day. We didn't venture into the restaurant so I have no review of there other than 30 odd euros seemed expensive for a breakfast when there are a plethora of fantastic pastry shops within easy walking distance. At night, it can be somewhat scary going through small streets but for our four nights there we didn't encounter any problems. To anyone travelling to this hotel, I would strongly suggest putting all your valuables in the safe at only 2 euros per night(plus tax) and take as little out as need be. Despite warnings everywhere about pick pockets, I had my purse stolen as I was jumping on the metro. Be very aware that these people are professinals. Barcelona on the whole was a fantastic place, I was strongly suggest taking the 2 day pass on the bus turistic however, once you get the hang of the bus and metro system, it's really not hard to navigate your way to the sights. The Sagrada Familia is an absolute must! If you are brave enough there are some great places to be found off the beaten track - Hotel Senetor has a fantastic spa open to the public - 3 hours of relaxation, floating in pools with oranges in and a whole host of crazy but fantastic experiences - and at only 15 euros, it is well worth it! In terms of food, Barcelona is not as far as I could tell a vegetarian friendly city. I often found it hard to find something I fancied but experimentation opened my eyes to a world of things I never would have tried. There is a great Veggie restaurant called Organic which is well worth a visit. And Sinatra's round the corner from Placa Real does fab Tapas if you want to try something new. This city is a great place to visit but do invest in a good tourist guide. As a supplement and if you are a bit daring - buy LeCools guide to Barcelona which has some great non-touristy suggestions. Hope this helps anyone contemplating a trip to Barcelona - DO IT!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: sasja
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother for three days. We had a spacious very calm, clean room with a very good bed and bathroom. Breakfast was good. Staff was helpfull; made all our restaurant reservations, gave helpfull tips about dinner hours in Barcelona. Free internet provided. (very handy). And the location couldn't be better, just around the corner of a lovely square, where you could hang out both for drinks (cava is only 2 euro's a glass) and tapas. Hotel is in an old building, but with an almost completely new interior. (don't expect a romantic crooked room). It's modern, efficient, clean not cheaply furnished, but certainly not the typical spanisch "hostal". My mother was really content; it was the kind of hotel where she could have a nice rest in the afternoon from the very busy city.

Reviews.Title: “Great City! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: martyap
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three nights in the Raco del Pi. A short walk to Las Ramblas and as said before a location that cannot be beat. Was in room 204 with a small balcony overlooking Carrer del Pi. Only noise at night was the garbage collection. The area is really quiet after the shops close. At night it is best to stick to the main streets and aviod the dark/quiet ones. Room was clean and functional and the staff was great. Beds were hard but did not prevent us from sleeping after touring all day. Water, pastries and coffee available daily right outside the small breakfast room. We did have breakfast the first night at the 1/2 price rate of 7e...not worth the regular 14e rate...plenty of places to grab breakfast. Right next door is an inside shopping gallery with some cute shops including a very small family owned food counter which opens at 9:00am. Breakfast for two was about 7e. Great fresh squeezed zumo de narranja. We tried Taller de Tapas close to the hotel and was not impressed. Prices were high and food was so-so. If you want tapas go to one of the many small tavernas. Tapas are about 1,60e each and you select right off the counter. They count the toothpicks after and charge you accordingly. Great with beer or cava. Also, go to Placa Real about a ten minute walk. Many great restaurants including Les Quintz Nitz. Join the line about 8:00 pm for the 8:30 seating. VERY reasonable...great variety and super food. Four of us had three courses and wine for 80e. And do not miss grabbing some fruit, a bocadilla or pastries at La Boqueria Market also a ten minute walk right on Las Ramblas. We used the Tourist bus and it was a great way to see the entire city if the weather is good and you can sit on top. We lucked out and it was 68-72 with no rain every day. Taxi cost about 30e to the airport as they do charge a luggage surcharge which seems to have no set rate. Many taxis cannot find the hotel. Heading up Las Ramblas.... turn right after you pass La Boqueria...then the second right on Carrer del Pi. Our friends stayed at the MonteCarlo right on Las Ramblas for three times the price. Room was certainly much nicer but we were glad we picked the Raco del Pi. Will return on our next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A great city and a great location”
Reviews.Author: PAndrew32
Reviews.Content: Another great hotel found thanks to the advice given by Trip Advisor. It was great to receive a glass of nice chillied Cava on arrival and the staff were friendly and polite. Breakfast was an excellent affair (not sure about the scrambled eggs though) and although we never used the bar service it was another nice touch. The hotel itself is very modern, small however very comfy. The double room we booked was very good value (go to justhotel.com website) with two single rock hard beds put together.The shower room was slippery and the air con was a nice. Be aware of the lack of hangers and pack a few extras. The big up is the location. It cannot be beaten. All in all we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest location!”
Reviews.Author: Deborah4967
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for walking around, shopping, sightseeing - we love the neighborhood! Knowledgeable and friendly hotel staff, quiet room overlooking a back street, free internet access was essential for changing travel plans. Sleep late and eat breakfast at one of the cafes around the corner, but we had an early breakfast at the excellent hotel buffet the day we had to leave. Room is not too small, but modern and clean. The air conditioning was very subtle, the marble bathroom floor is treacherously slippery after a shower, and the bed really is quite hard. But we intend to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hermosa90254
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. It is conveniently located in the heart of the old city, only minutes from the metro and La Rambla. We had a great room on the 4th floor, and though it overlooked th pedestrian area, we did not find the noise at night to be a problem. The room was a good size and the bathroom was not to be believed. The staff was very friendly, greeted us cheerfully every morning and every evening; answered all our questions, provided restaurant recommendations, provided directions, etc. The late afternoon snacks in the lounge area were a bonus. Can't say enough good things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: TheKatt
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel! Great location, close to everything. Ask for room #202. HUGE room with a jetted tub, that is wonderful after walking around all day. Very clean and quiet, small balcony overlooking the shopping area. Free internet and champagne everyday. Front staff alittle snooty and not to smart about where things are, considering they live in Spain and work with tourists, but that can be overlooked for the great room and location. Have stayed in many 5 star hotels and would definatly come back to the Raco Del Pi!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but does not live up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: JayPDee
Reviews.Content: The location - absolutely excellent. You couldn't wish for better. Easy walking distance to La Rambla and the underground. The rest was, well, average. We arrived on Friday 29/09 at 7.30pm and were greeted by a full compliment of departing guests hogging reception... waiting for their taxi to the airport. The reception is very small. Eventually the receptionist turned up and copied our passports before advising us we would be staying in room 107. No cava offered... Overlooking a narrow, deserted side-street the room was quite small but very crisp and clean. The bathroom was also small and neat and exhibited the fresh flower and wide range of toiletries as descirbed in previous guest reports. We were lucky enough to have a full height 'patio'-style door that opened onto a very small balcony. The air conditioning worked perfectly despite the daytime temperature averaging 28 degrees, for early October... The breakfast was superb, with every conceivable taste catered for. Although it was charged at €14 (per person) for the first 2 mornings it was only €7 for the 3rd morning, this averages at £7.50 (€11.50/$13.50) per day for as much as you can possibly eat and drink, excellent value. The free internet was present but nearly always fully occupied from early in the morning 'til late at night. The free coffee, water and pastries were very pleasant after a long days' trekking but only made up for the lack of such facilities in the guest rooms. Overall a very pleasant stay. For the location and facilities in the great city of Barcelona the H10 Raco del Pi offers a discrete but average experience. Just don't expect 4-star quality for a 3-star price.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was really lovely ...”
Reviews.Author: Carrie8080
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really lovely. My friend and I stayed here for the weekend a couple of weeks back. On arrival we were offered a glass of Cava and made aware of the free crossiants that we could help ourselve to throughout our stay - great! The room was massive and clean throughout. The bathroom gorgeous. Though located right in the heart of Las Ramblas which was a plus point for us, when walking back after a meal out the streets were less busy with people and we were conscious to keep our wits about us as we wondered back. We would go back again though.

Reviews.Title: “Can this be the same hotel everyone else here stayed at?”
Reviews.Author: Madre_di_Dios
Reviews.Content: After reading other glowing reviews here about the H10 Raco del Pi in Barcelona, my friend and I booked a double room there more than 6 months in advance of our trip, confident it would be a great place to stay. Our flight arrived in Barcelona very early local time, so when I confirmed our reservation in writing a week in advance of our arrival, I requested early check-in. Nope! They couldn't be bothered to arrange this, not even with a week's advance notice. The hotel did not let us check in a second before 2:00 p.m. Exhausted and unbathed, up for more than 24 hours straight, we had to wander around Barcelona in a sleep-deprived stupor before many places were even open. You can't tell me they couldn't have compromised and had a clean room for us by NOON, with a week's notice, at the very least. Our room was a colossal disappointment. We had room 101, which must be very different from the guest rooms described by other reviewers. It was a dim and depressing 9' x 9' not counting the bathroom. There were no luggage racks, only two tiny sock drawers, and no place to conveniently stow luggage out of our ways, even on the floor. The "two beds" I'd requested were twin beds with about 2" of space between. If the tile floor was ever swept or mopped the whole time we were there, I'd be surprised, because my socks turned black walking on that floor. The air conditioning and air circulation was beyond abysmal; the air reeked of stale smoke and never, ever changed. Even overnight, even cranked, the air conditioning never quite cut it. Window was locked shut. The front desk staff seemed polite, professional and made earnest attempts to accommodate us, but the housekeeping staff was puzzling at best. Although there were two people in the room, the housekeeping staff only provided towels for one. When we finally got them to start providing enough towels for two, we still couldn't get them to give us an extra washcloth. We left a note with a tip of 3 Euro (we tipped every day about this amount) asking for "por favor, uno mas toallita." We returned about 2:00 that afternoon to find both the tip and the note GONE, but our room still not made up. A few minutes later, a housekeeper came by with two more towels, not washcloths. Our Spanish was not so awful that we couldn't hear her cackling to the other housekeepers outside the door about the "weirdos in 101" who wanted all the extra towels. From then on, we did not leave tips! Although the tile in the bathroom was lovely, the loose-fitting shower door inevitably allowed a lake of water to leak onto the floor during every shower, and a sole towel hook meant that one of us always had to hang her towel in the closet. The room was also poorly insulated against sound, and late-night partiers lurching around and yelling to one another through the stairwells easily woke us. Our conclusion is that this is a 2-star hotel that charges and masquerades as a 3-star hotel. Although the Barri Gotic is a fascinating neighborhood and very walkable, if you're looking for comfort and cleanliness, I'd recommend going elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: jlafata
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location is excellent in middle of gothic quarter, tons of restaurants, shops, plazas, within walking distance of everything. The staff was superb - super friendly. I didn't have a converter for my cell phone charger - they had one for me to borrow so I could charge my phone. It was pouring rain one day - they had umbrellas for the guests to borrow. Free internet access in lobby so you can check your email. Our room had a balcony overlooking the street and was a beautiful view, the bathroom had slate tiled floors, 2 sinks, and a jetted bathtub with shower, fresh flower. You should request a quiet room with a view for these types of things, the hotel usually complies and there is no extra fee for these "nicer" rooms. The rooms furniture and accents are also new and updated. Feels like the hotel just opened a few months ago. Cons: The hotel is in an area that is not serviced by cars, but alhtough we couldn't take a taxi into the hotel, the hotel was able to arrange a taxi from the hotel door to get to the airport. For 134 EUROS this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location!”
Reviews.Author: Griff_Yorks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Raco Del Pi on 18th August until the 22nd August. The hotel is really easy to find, we got the airport bus which runs every 15 mins and costs 3.75 Euros, the service terminates at Place De Catalunya and the hotel is just a good 5 mins walk from there. We were greeted by really friendly staff at the hotel reception and offered a nice cold glass of Cava, which was most welcome after the journey! The rooms have a contemporary, modern feel to them, the only slight criticism i would have is some more coathangers in the wardrobe and a chest of drawers would have been handy. The Hotel is just off Las Ramblas in the Barri Gotic, which is a wonderful maze of medieval streets/alleys, it is well situated for all the major attractions, the Metro system and buses are easily accessible. If i visit Barcelona again i would definitely book into this hotel without a second thought. Donna and Adrian, Barnsley, South Yorkshire, England

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: minnie_cooper
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as part of a surprise 60th birthday trip to Barcelona for my Dad, also taking my mother, my partner and 15 month old baby son. I booked on the high recommendations from this website, and the location and price - and I am so glad that I did. My parents absolutely loved it, saying that it was one of the best hotels that they had stayed in (and they're very well travelled!). Our room was a little dark, facing the inside of the courtyard -but it was also quite spacious, which we needed with the supplied babies cot in the room. And my parents room, next door but one, had a beautiful balcony looking out to the street below. Even though the hotel is thoroughly modernised, it hasn't lost the historic character of the original building, with very high beamed ceilings in the rooms and the original stone staircase. The breakfast is well worth getting, with a huge range of delicious food to choose from. An added bonus for us was that the staff were SO lovely to my son, and every morning took him off to meet everyone in the kitchen, which gave me and my partner a welcome break to eat our breakfast in peace. The location is unrivalled in one of the prettiest quiet little streets in the Gothic Quarter, and a 2 minute walk from the amazing food market. All in all, a wonderful stay, at a lovely hotel small enough to retain the personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellemt”
Reviews.Author: kasi
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from very long weekend in Barcelona. The Raco del Pi is lovely, it has to be the cleanest hotel I've ever seen. The staff were very helpful and polite. Flowers in the bathroom. Not only were the rooms tidied every day , the towels were changed everyday instead of every other day The glass of Cava on arrival is a lovely touch as is the free coffee and cake in the afternoons. We stayed on the third floor with a balcony at the front of the hotel and wasn't disturbed by noise at all. I didn't find the area in the least bit intimidating, in fact was quite quaint. The only thing for me that stops this 4 star is no pool and entertainment in the evenings, but to be honest, with the beach down the road and the amount of bars and restaurants I don't think we'd have had time to use them anyway.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!! 10/10”
Reviews.Author: KD2007Lurgan
Reviews.Content: Just home after spending 5 fantastic nights in this hotel and is probably one of the best hotels i've ever stayed in. Great location, friendly staff and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona The complimentary pastries, coffee and mineral water make a great free lunch. The breakfast is also good. The rooms are very well presented and the external terrace is great for sitting in the sun and reading the morning papers. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and speak perfect english. This hotel has it all....10 out of 10!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: camelduke
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Raco del Pi in Barcelona. Great central location right off the Ramblas. Very near metro station, Boqueria market, and tons of restaurants--but far enough away to avoid the noise. Very clean & new-looking hotel. Rooms well-appointed. Extremely nice bathroom with tiled walls. Very reasonable cost. Small & separate beds--but what do you expect in Europe! After a long day walking around Barcelona, you'll sleep just fine. Even for me (and I'm 6'4"). Recommend interior room--heard exterior rooms were a tad noisy. I would highly recommend the Raco del Pi. I would definitely stay again on my next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “21st Birthday Celebration”
Reviews.Author: Coljoh
Reviews.Content: My son recently celebrated his 21st birthday so we went as a family group to the Raco Del Pi hotel. My wife had viewed the hotel on a website (Venere.[--]) and decided it met our needs ie central location, air conditioned rooms, free internet access. We had read previously that a free glass of cava was given upon arrival, but the bottle was nearly empty so we did not all get a glass. This was a small point and not a great concern, to be frank. The rooms were small but well appointed, even including items like toothbrushes, shoe cleaning kit, shaving kit. The staff throughout the hotel were polite and helpful and all spoke English much better than I spoke Spanish. At the end of the day, there was free coffee, tea, water, cakes available in the bar area. In fact, I believe this was available throughout the day. On occasion, supplies were low but these were replenished by asking any of the hotel staff. Breakfast was not cheap but I found the selection of hot and cold dishes to my taste. Eating out was not as good as hoped for.The service in many of the restaurants in La Rambla and adjoining areas left a bit to be desired. I would say that if top quality food is your priority, then Barcelona is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, Hot, Conjested”
Reviews.Author: AJOK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the H10 Raco Del Pi 5-12 July 2006. It was our first visit to Barcelona, and we chose to go to this hotel on previous recommendations posted here. We agreed that the rooms were rather small although the air conditioning was good as it was baking hot outside. The hotel was ok, although a bit expensive, but considering the location was very central, but quite hard to find as all surrounding streets were pedestrians only. La Rambla is only minutes away from the hotel. Breakfast was an extra £14 euros per person per day, plus 2 euros per day if you wanted to use the room safe. Free tea & coffee at the small bar, but no tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms, which was disappointing. For those considering taking/hiring a car to get to Barcelona, forget it totally, there are no parking places anywhere. We left our car in a public car park the first night, which cost 23 euros. We then tried to find alternative parking the next day, and found a parking place 8 kilometres from our hotel in the Val De Hebron area, and had to use the subway to get back to the hotel. We left the car there for 3 days, then used the public car park for the rest of the stay. The hotel does have an arrangement for parking around the Cathedral we found out too late, but it's almost 22 euros per night. It's also a nightmare driving in Barcelona, it's always totally conjested, night & day, and you can't even stop to look at a map. Weather was very hot & humid, around 93 degrees most days. Subways are air conditioned and regular, if you can stand the 100 degrees on the platform waiting for the train. All in all it's a nice, clean small hotel, rather expensive tho. Note :- The police will stop you and warn you to be vigilant if they see you're wallet in your back pocket, as there are pick pockets. Also watch out for young women with babies. They gather round you in crowds begging, and looking for something to steal. Prices... as usual the busiest, like La Rambla will set you back 17 euros for 2 drinks (Bacardi/Pint of beer), go a bit further out and prices come down to around 12 euros. After we'd seen the Nucamp Stadium, we used the car to travel to Tarragonna, and Calella & Loret de Mar, very pleasant. Verdict.. nice city, but too hot & humid & conjested to see much of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in the H10 Raco del Pi - it was very clean, comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful. The location is excellent as it is very central and it's easy to walk just about everywhere but if you need to use the subway, there is a stop a few blocks away. There are some great tapas choices very close to the hotel as well. Las Ramblas is worth a walk down, but it's very crowded and very touristy, which we typically don't enjoy, but worth a walk down at least once. The Boqueira market is also an interesting stop just off Las Ramblas. Barecelona as a city has a great bohemian energy that makes it stand out compared to other major European cities.

Reviews.Title: “does what it say's on the?”
Reviews.Author: pyrford
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a birthday present,I selected it having read other reviews,and it does exactly what it sets out to do.Great hotel for its position in relation to the city sites.I know there have been comments about the price of breakfast,but when you consider bacon and eggs (hot) cold meats yougart,cereals,fruit,rolls and a choice of jams,etc,etc.Its not that over priced.Its very clean and well looked after a credit to the group(H10).We'd consider using them again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: dandb
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on previous reviews and location. We were not disappointed with the location, we loved this area best in Barcelona. The hotel staff were superb, we were welcomed on arrival with a glass of cava, as written about in other reviews, the staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The hotel was modern in decoration and we loved the corridor glass walls view through the to the courtyard below. Our room was on the the 3rd floor, it was beautifully clean. Although not large, the room size was adequate with basic furnishings, the bed was surprisingly comfortable despite being very firm. The only downsides to the room we had were (a) The view out of our room window wasn't great at all (b) It was a smoking room and smelt badly of smoke on our arrival. Unfortunately, our travel agents hadn't passed on our request for non-smoking, and they were none available. However, the duty reception staff arranged to have the room freshened, which immediately cleared the problem for us and finally (c) Our room was close to the lift, which did disturb me late at night. However, we still thought the hotel was very good despite the above. We found the breakfast provided an excellent choice to set you up for the day and the tea/coffee/pastries that you could help yourself to in the bar during the day, a really nice touch along with the free internet facility. If we ever returned to Barcelona, I would choose to stay at this hotel again - but with a request for different room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Well pleased with the Raco di Pi”
Reviews.Author: JohnSwin
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the Raco Di Pi excellent service great room Really good location. Close to Las Ramblas and the main square. The best value was the turistbus 2 day pass

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position, great price/quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: frombaritomiami
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife at Raco del Pi over the last week of May 2006 and it was overall a very good experience. I can repeat all other things that other reviewers have already stressed, but I will concentrate on a few inside tips for this specific hotel. HOW TO GET THERE: Remember oyu are in the Gothic quarter, the taxi will not be able to drop you off in front of the hotel during regular hours, since it is a pedestrian zone, but your walk will be short. On the way back, if you are leaving early in the morning, the cab will definitely pick you up at the door. Just remember the time of the day makes a huge difference between nobody in the streets and hundreds of people walking with you... ROOMS/LOCATION: Location, excellent in the middle of the Gothic quarter. If you have a room with balcony (Rooms 01-04 on each floor) you will have more noise but a larger room. If you stay, like I did, in rooms (08-09) it will be in a smaller room but super quiet (only minor problem in room 309 was that the maid storage room was near our room and when she would come in the morning you could hear her pull the cart and her stuff out of the room). CLEANLINESS/MODERN: Rarely have I seen such a cleaner hotel, and since it is new, all areas exude modern clean taste without looking cold. BREAKFAST: Although lovers of continental breakfast will find everything under the sun in the small restaurant room in the morning, you can have a very large breakfast in the croissanterie right in front of the hotel for a quarter of the price. Only trick (already mentioned): first day is half off, so have breakfast there the first morning until you find a good spot for the following days. The best is the free food left at the bar 24 hours a day for the guests, not so much for the pastries, which are just the leftover from breakfast and get stale by the evening, but for the free water that is a nice gesture since you will be walking a lot in the city and a nice glass of water upon arriving to the hotel before you go to your room is great. INTERNET: It all depends on the other hotel guests: there were days in which nobody would be there, ther were days when one person would be sitting there for hours at a time. Moreover, it is only one computer open to anybody but also to everybody's view, so forget privacy... LOBBY: they do ask you to leave the keys at the desk when you leave (?) they must have had bad experiences, but they are very nice and helpful. Yes, there is free cava (champagne-like wine) but after the first couple of days you want to go and drink it in the bars and restaurants, not in the hotel lobby... Also, remember, the safe is not included in the price, and it is 2 euros a day. OVERALL: To recommend for the best location in a relative quiet area and the clean modern look, great service.

Reviews.Title: “New room, old city”
Reviews.Author: Jumper71
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days at Raco Del Pi based on reccomendation on this page. Noted at that time that some found the noise from the pedestriants annoying. What can you expect if you live in the middle of a crowded city? Loved the hotel, attending staff, nice touch with free cava at arrival, yacuzzi in the bathroom. And to be honest, seriously good roomsize to be in Europe. We stayed (if i remember correctly) in room 202 and had a small balcony were we had some snacks in the afternoon from the local tapasbar. Don't go for the mature Manchego, but the semidry, it's superb. We have tipped several friends about the hotel and all have been thankful. Not a hotel for a businesstraveller but great for a tourist passing through.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully clean and beautifully located”
Reviews.Author: Hyking
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay in Barcelona at the Raco del Pi. Would highly recommend this boutique hotel to anyone looking for a short stay in the city. It is superbly located - cannot think of a better location, certainly for a first visit to the city. Situated in the narrow lanes by the Ramblas, it is perfect for hopping on to the sight seeing buses - a real must - or strolling out to the shops, and, in the evening, soaking in the historic atmosphere of the squares, the street artists and the open air restaurants. The rooms are compact, but extremely well appointed. The whole hotel is absolutely spotless. The staff are courteous and very helpful. The breakfast is excellent. The internet facilities are free. The atmosphere and presentation of the place exudes polished, simple quality. And, by the way, the room air-conditioning was not only efficient, but unobtrusive - a rarity in my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary07
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at the H10 Raco del Pi, 27 April - 2 May. Previously asked for 'a quiet room on the 2nd or 3rd floor' and got one - room 207 at the back of the hotel. Size OK by European city standards. Spotlessly clean, good bathroom facilities. Room safe, 2 euros a day. No view - overlooked a wall - but not overlooked by anyone. Air conditioning worked fine, at night we could close the window and there was no noise at all. Really quiet for the centre of a major city. If you want a better view, the rooms at the front overlooked the Carrer del Pi, lovely pedestrian street with lots of little shops. These would have had a more attractive outlook but you would have got quite a lot of 'people noise'. Depends what you want, we wanted quiet and got it. Probably best to specify the room location when you book. Other reviewers have mentioned hearing people walking on the hard floors - I have to say we heard virtually no noise of this type. Just one thing - the bed (double) was very hard. We got used to it after the first night. As for the rest of the hotel - friendly efficient welcome including glass of cava. Excellent breakfast - discount rate of 7 euros for first day, thereafter 14 euros. We didn't have breakfast there every day. Coffee/croissants available in the bar area at all hours after breakfast, also apples. Computer in bar area for free internet access. Locked luggage room. Location - we found it very convenient. Ramblas/Liceu metro about 2 minutes walk. Plaza de Catalunya (aerobus to airport) about 5 minutes walk. Gothic quarter was lovely by day, not so attractive at night when shop fronts are covered by metal grilles with graffiti. It felt safe at all times if you stuck to the wider streets, though we weren't out late at night. Took the usual precautions but no problems with pickpockets etc. at any time, didn't see anyone else having problems either. Taller de Tapas just round the corner was a good place to eat. Also liked Trobador in C/ Ferran at the Plaza St Jaume end. We bought the Barcelona Card, ideal for a stay of 5 days, free transport (used the metro) and discount on all admissions. Buy it in advance online, it's cheaper, and pick it up from the tourist office at the airport or the Plaza de Catalunya. For a shorter stay (say 2 days) Bus Turistic would be better. Highlights for us were the Casa Batllo, Sagrada Familia & Palau de la Musica Catalunya. Also had time for a train trip to Montserrat which was lovely, especially if you are prepared to escape the crowds round the monastery and head for the footpaths.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but a couple of niggles”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked on the basis of reviews here however did not quite live up to the expectations I had after the reviews here. The location is good if a bit difficult to find at first through some lanes, it is a good base. 5-10 minute walk from la rambla, close to gothic quarter shops and restaurants in immediate vicinity. Room was a bit on the small side but clean. TV reception not great but worst of all hoovering at 8 am in the room above - or at least thats what it sounded like. Free water and pastries plus cava on arrival, also free internet, staff friendly and helpful, extra charge for safe. They also left a note with some chocolates on my partners birthday which was a nice touch. On enquiring about extending our stay I thought it was rather expensive at 220 euros per night, so we went somewhere else for the remainder of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: dinkey
Reviews.Content: my wife and i returned to barcelona in january this year and stayed at this hotel for the first time.location is execllent ,staff very friendly,rooms small but very clean and comfortable and all that you need really as we didn't spend much time in it.would go back again

Reviews.Title: “you must go to h10 raco del pi!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we have just retured from a long weekend at the h10 Raco Del Pi, barcelona. i chose this hotel because of its location (which is perfect to get around to the sights from) i checked it on trip advisor before we went and was very pleased, it had so many good reviews and would agree with everything people said in their reviews. i was slightly concerned about having a room on the fourth floor and facing the street as these are what some people werent pleased with. we had a good room on the 3rd floor (308) which was very spacious and clean. the staff are fantastic- very helpful and friendly. we went on the bus turistic to get to all the far away sights which was good, although i wouldnt recommend it on a 'fiesta' (we were there on la diada de sant jordi 23rd april like our valentines day) it is very busy!!! overall this hotel is worth more than its 3* i enjoyed every minute of my trip to barcelona and will be returning to the h10 raco del pi, barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the raco del pi mainly because of the good reviews here and elsewhere. However, reality did not match up to expectation in some aspects.Yes the location was excellent, yes the hotel was clean, and the glass of cava on arrival was appreciated (but was this just a diversion?).We too were given a 'cell type room'(two grilled tiny windows at floor level and a skylight - 4th floor beware!).My husband therefore asked politely if there were any other rooms available with a window. This was received with a 'humph and a shrug' with the reply that a room would be available after 2pm. This was not a problem as we did not really expect to be allocated a room before this time. We had arrived about 12 o'clock and really just expected to drop off our luggage.We therefore set off to explore and returned to settle in the new room. The second room no.108 was much smaller with a tiny shower room (no bath), but yes it did have a window- looking onto a wall 4 feet away! Gave up at this point! All in all a little disappointing given some of the rave reviews. However we had a good holiday despite the accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “An integral part of our great holiday”
Reviews.Author: Infantraveller
Reviews.Content: I just arrived from a great though all-too-brief family holiday in Barcelona with my husband and our only son. This is an excellent hotel, with friendly staff, the perfect location and yes, Taller de Tapas closeby, which has an equally good atmosphere and staff. The big bonus for my little boy was the ice cream shop (Carte d'Or) just around the corner, on the square. The location is really faultless, walking distance to so many important sites, including the Cathedral and of course La Rambla. The hotel put us in a quiet triple room where we felt snug and safe. The receptionists/concierge were very friendly and professional -- always willing to help. Breakfasts are good too, and optional. And with a complimentary glass of champagne, what a nice way to start a holiday! We would visit Barcelona again if only to stay in this friendly pocket of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Offpiste
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last week of March and had a great time mainly due to its location and convenience to all centrally located activities. We were originally hestitant because of a previous review stating that a sex shop was near the premises. We decided to take our chances and were pleasantly surprised. The shop in question was simply a lingerie shop which sold sexual paraphernalia. We had a quite room facing the central open atrium not one facing the pedestrian areas...we heard it could be loud at times especially w/ a 2-1/2 year old. If you decide you want a similar quite room request one on the 2nd or 3rd floors. The window level of these floors would be well above the atrium floor and would allow you to leave the window open w/o any concerns. They also have quite rooms facing the back of the hotel which also could be a benefit. The hotel could use some carpet or other sound dampening materials because you will hear people walking on the hard floors at all hours.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and spotless”
Reviews.Author: Halinag
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2nd visit to Barcelona and would highly recommend the Raco Del Pi Hotel. I am very fussy about Hotels and normally only ever stay 4* or 5*. We had this hotel recommended to us and were delighted with it. Spotless in every area and simple modern design making it a fantastic choice. Location is excellent. Breakfast was included and it was perfect to set you up for the day. Lots of choice and good service. Staff very friendly on reception and made you feel very welcome. Cava on arrival was nice too!! Definately would choose Raco Del Pi next time. Taller de Tapas well worth a visit and is just around the corner, geat food, atmosphere and really friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A great time at Raco Del Pi”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a two night midweek break. Raco Del Pi was ideally located do all the things suggested in the guidebooks. We chose not to eat in the hotel due to the assortment of restaurants and cafe/bars nearby. A very clean hotel right in the heart of this great city. It was a little noisy but for us this was all part of the experience and atmosphere. Sagrada Familia and Casa Batllo are must sees. Relax for an hour or two in Parc Guell and take in the views of the city. Try the Tapas in Taller De Tapas, just a minute's stroll away in Sant Josep Oriol! Loads of great chocolate shops. Come on guys miss the football and treat your partner to a great short break.

Reviews.Title: “An Outstanding Location”
Reviews.Author: MerryMom
Reviews.Content: This hotel, tucked into a street just off of Los Ramblas, was a highlight of our trip. We were in Barcelona for almost a week before boarding our ship, and the ambiance of this (almost cozy) hotel was a treasure. The breakfast was perfect to send us out for a day of sight seeing, and there was coffee or tea and possibly some pastries when we returned. Our room was in the back which was on a somewhat noisy street, but it quieted down after 9:00 pm. There is character to this hotel, and it was immaculate to boot. I've recommended it highly to anyone who says they're going to this great city, and we intend to return at another time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent break”
Reviews.Author: gofar
Reviews.Content: A very good base to explore Barcelona. Easily found and within walking distance to all tourist areas.Try the 'Taller De Tapas'for excellent tapas or visit Vildsvin L'Antiga Taverna for a more formal evening meal,both are walking distance from the hotel.Very friendly staff (day and night) ask them any questions and they are happy to assist.Clean and functional rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: emmalm
Reviews.Content: The best thing going for the Hotel Raco del Pi is the location. Its perfect for getting to the metro or wandering around the Barri Gotic (Gothic Quarter), there are a couple of pretty squares just around the corner. The hotel is one step up from a travelodge type place, the staff are very helpful and friendly and you are offered a glass of free cava to get you in the holiday mood on arrival. The rooms are not a bad size and are clean. We were a little disappointed as we only had a small slit of a window and two roof top portholes, which meant we didn't have a view (Room 403). As we didn't have a big window to open it got incredibly hot and stuffy in there at night. All in all although it was a great location, I might be tempted to try another hotel in a similar area.

Reviews.Title: “An Adequate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ramchalice
Reviews.Content: Just back from four nights at the Hotel Del Pi. Overall, an adequate hotel, but don't quite understand many of the rave reviews. I found the location one of its pluses. Another plus is the cleanliless of the rooms. The buffet breakfast is excellent but rather pricey at 14 Euros. Two significant negatives. It was very noisy. The lack of any carpeting and heavy noisy doors made the arrival or departure of anyone on your floor an event that was difficult to miss. Second, was the lack of furnishings in their single rooms. I'm used to small European singles so that wasn't a surprise. What was odd is that there was virtually no surface on which to place anything. A tiny surface protruding from the wall which was a sort of nightstand but which was almost totally covered by the telephone; a TV stand and a bed; and finally a straight back chair. This chair was the only available surface on which to place one's personal items. I suppose one could do worse and maybe the double rooms include furniture, but I'd probably recommend looking elsewhere in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we booked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Raco DEl Pi from the 1st February 06 for 5 nights. Booked through Expedia (make sure your breakfast is included in price) all our arrangements went smoothly except the taxi driver we used from the bus station had to drop us in La Ramblas as he said he was not allowed in the area around the hotel. This meant dragging our cases 250m through the narrow streets in the late evening. Taxis are allowed in to the area and we booked them through reception on our departure. Could not fault the hotel staff or great breakfast. Room was ok if a little basic. Our room was at the front overlooking the pedestrianised street. Noise was not a problem for me but my wife said there was some noise at night. Area was great for shops and dining out. Nearest tube was in La Ramblas about 200m away. Do buy a Barcelona Card for travel around Barcelona. We bought ours on the internet and then collected it from the TIC in Cataluna Square, 250m from the hotel. One word of warning. Watch out for pickpockets. My wife was targetted at the north bus station after arriving from Girona airport. Luckily she realised what was going on and only lost a pair of glasses.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, sketchy location”
Reviews.Author: alamosf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Raco del Pi for six nights in December and while I thought the hotel itself was very well-managed (spotless rooms and responsive staff) and the amenities, especially the free in-room internet hookup since I'd brought my laptop, were excellent, I agree with a previous post which mentioned that the hotel's location leaves much to be desired. While the hotel is right smack in the center of the action, especially for the daily evening 'paseo' (the stroll that most Europeans take at dusk), I would prefer to join this daily ritual at will and not be subjected to injecting myself into a mass of people each time I leave the hotel. I consider myself a somewhat experienced traveler, having been all over Asia and Europe doing the 'backpacker' thing, and now that I'm perhaps a little older and a bit more cautious, I would have preferred something a bit more quiet and further away from the 'action'. Yes, there is a sex shop next door and many tacky shops in the immediate vicinity. If ever I do go back to Barcelona, I'd choose to stay in the adjacent Eixample neighborhood which has wide boulevards and a reasonable amount of commercial activity and establishments (banks, restaurants, shops), enough to reassure visitors of 'being' in Barcelona without having to deal with the tackier side of it all. And don't worry - the Barri Gotic is just an interesting 10-minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean rooms, great location, impeccable service, and delicious breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: sklo2004
Reviews.Content: You really cannot find a hotel that is more centrally located than H10 Raco del Pi. It is 2 blocks away from Las Ramblas, right in the middle of Barri Gotic's excitement. There are countless shops (from antique, clothing, art, to accessories), restaurants, cafes, and beautiful landmarks within 50 footsteps. If you are looking for a real taste of Gothic Quarters energy and spirit, this is the ideal place to stay. It's a very exciting and active location. If you can, ask for a window that oversees the Gothic Quarters. It may be loud (so don't do that if you want peace and quiet), but it allows you to soak in the environment. The room itself is clean and spacious. Furnishing is modern and simple- not elegant but is comfortable. The front desk staff is so consistenly friendly and helpful. The free daily breakfast buffet was delicious. It wasn't just continental, they served sausages, eggs, fresh fruits, muffins, cheese plates and cure meat plates. I thought it was refreshing to have normal sausage and eggs again after 10 days of "jamon iberica" everywhere I went for breakfast. Coffee, tea and snack service is complimentary all day until 8pm. And even better, you get free Internet access too, although there is only one computer to serve the 20+ rooms of guests. I stayed in 2 different hotels while in Barcelona just to try out different areas. Avenida Palace, the other hotel I stayed at, although more opulent and elegant in decor, cannot compare to H10's service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Scary Location”
Reviews.Author: uskim
Reviews.Content: For my standard, I was scared to stay in this hotel. "Las Ramblas" is the tourist hangout place and is not elegant or pretty at night. This hotel is away from the main street and is located next to a s-- shop. No matter how great the service is,as far as I am concern in terms of location, I don't consider this as the best. There are plenty of great hotels in the better area. We ended up changing our hotel to Hotel Majestic. Yes. That was beautiful and elegant. I don't believe that all the previews are objective reviews.

Reviews.Title: “FAB - SHOULD BE CLASSED AS FOUR STAR!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for the centre of Barcelona, within minutes walking distance of Las Ramblas, very clean & modern hotel providing everything you need, the toiletries selection is amazing...even included shaving kit & toothbrush! Complimentary cava on arrival, pastries, water & coffee available all day. Staff very friendly & helpful. Never tried breakfast, but heard it was good & very reasonable, fantastic croissant shop straight opposite if you do not want breakfast in the hotel. If you are taking a taxi, get the driver to drop you off on Las Ramblas opposite the Liceu theatre, it is only minutes away from there.
