Cheap bar turn left out of the hotel, left at the end & then first right....only €1.45 a bottle of Estrella Damm (about £1!) Highly highly recommended...told all my friends about it & will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Could not find better location”
Reviews.Author: Mark235
Reviews.Content: I stayed in H10 Raco Del Pi between January 14 and 16. Great hotel. I have never been before to Barcelona and choose this hotel because of the previous review on Trip Advisor. I was not disappointed. The location is exceptional, about 1 minute walk from the Gothic Cathedral and 1 minute walk from Las Remblas. Despite the proximity of Las Remblas, the location is very safe (I walked in the Gothic quarter at around 1:30 a.m. and never felt threatened). Staff is helpful, though contrary to other review I was not welcomed with Cava. I did not pay 14 euros for the breakfast and found out that it was a good idea. There are plenty of cafes around the hotel where you can get breakfast for between 2 euros and 5 euros; for instance, on plaza del pi, just across the hotel, I got for 3.8 eurosa glass of freshly-pressed orange juice, a chocolate croissant and a milk coffee. Rooms are well-furnished and very clean. However, do not expect your room to have a great view, since the hotel is in a side street in the gothic quarter. The rooms with the best view are the ones located on the face of the street; all other rooms face walls of adjacent buildings. But this is really the only small disagreement one can find in this hotel. Finally, on an unrelated note, please be aware that some restaurants use their on conversion rates when you pay your meal with foreign credit cards. This happened to me in a restaurant just across the Sagrada Familia. I paid with a Canadian card and on my receipt there was a note specifying that I had accepted not to get Mastercard international conversion rate (2.5%) but rather the restaurant conversion rate (12% !!!). I was alone and did not spend much, but still it was an unpleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “you cant go wrong, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kjackson25
Reviews.Content: fantastic hotel, no complaints, very clean and smart. You get cava on arrival and a warm greeeting. Our room was not a large as some hotel rooms but it was very clean, smart and a lovely bathroom with lots of complimentary toiletries. Bed was hard but that was ideal for me, just to warn people who dont like hard beds. There is a little area downstairs which have self service coffee and pastries, this was great as after a long walk we would go to the hotel rather than a coffee shop for coffee, great coffee to. The internet corner is also very helpful. The location is perfect, about two minutes from the ramblas and cathedral, we walked everywhere. We took a bus from right outside the airport (3.60 euro single) which took us to Catalunya plaza and it was a 5 to 10 minute walk to the hotel if you dont want to cab, its also easy to find. We didnt have the breakfast so cant comment on food, but there are lots of little cafes nearby where we took breakfast. The place is fab, great location, great staff, great price.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: doownelg
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4day stay at H10 Raco Del Pi What a fabulous hotel greeted by the very friendly and helpful Roberto with a glass of champagne even though we were early our room was still ready and we were able to book in, excellent rooms with lots of extras not just your usual toiletries but toothbrush toothpaste sewing kit shoepolish etc. comfortable big bed and lovely bathroom all spotless done twice a day.Staff very very friendly and helpful nothing was to much bother from recommending the best atm to withdraw money to getting restaurants and taxis. Breakfast was plentiful with hot and cold selections fruit cakes even Champagne! Their was pastries and drinks available all day for guests at no extra charge great when you came in after a day of walking.This hotel is right in the middle of everything and quite safe to walk back to at night. Deserves more than a 3 star rating Will definetly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: travelscrapper
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night from a Ryan Air flight. Ryan air has a round trip bus service to downtown Barcelona from the Girona airport - very easy to use and costs 19 Euro for round trip per person. Bus station is a 5 Euro taxi ride to the hotel. Even though we arrived late, we were greeted very warmly. Hotel staff served champaign and fruit, showed us to our room and gave us directions to several good restaurants. Hotel was clean and they gave us a half priced breakfast the first day. The only negative thing, and it wasn't the hotel's fault, was it was really noisy. Lot's of street noise - you can hear everything; people talking, construction (someone jackhammering at 6 a.m.???!!!) Definitely request a room away from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the H10 Raco del Pi”
Reviews.Author: avery99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of our trip and one more night at the end. We loved everything about the hotel. Our only complaint was that the bed was a little hard but by the time we went to sleep at night, we really didn't care much about it. The location can't be beat, the staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms were small but clean and the bathrooms were of a decent size. There is free internet access which we found to be invaluable. Also, they give you free water, coffee, tea, and snacks which were small pastries downstairs in the bar area. They offer a breakfast for 7E each but we preferred to go out and get our own breakfast for less money. I would definately stay at this hotel again and found that the price was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to Barri Gotic, Cathedral and Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: loulan
Reviews.Content: Great location of this hotel. Just a short distance to so many tourist attractions, the Cathedral, Las Ramblas and Barri Gotic. Many things to choose from for Breakfast scrambled eggs, sausage (like a hot dog), pastries, cold cuts and cereals. It is in a shopping area so if you need to pick up a gift item it is very convenient. Our room had two twin beds pushed close together. Our non smoking room faced the inner courtyard so we had no problem with noise or smoking smells from others. You need to have the room key in the slot by the door in order for the air conditioning to work. It does take a while for the room to cool down but was comfortable to sleep in. Staff was friendly and helpful with directions. Also it was nice to have internet to send a quick message back to family. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent. The free champagne at check-in. The room. The breakfast. The mineral water and soft drinks and peanuts at the outdoor patio. One thing that I did appreciate was the written safety material provided at check-in. The woman at the check-in desk made a point of saying, "It is unfortunate that we have a problem with theft here in Barcelona. Here is some written material about safety precautions. Please read it." I had never had someone say that and, quite frankly, it spooked me a little bit. I did, however, read the material when I got to my room. Mostly common sense suggestions, though my sensitivity was heigntened. One thing that was emphasized was the fact that theft was partuicularly rampant near the central railway station. I broke-up my trip in Barcelona with a few days in Palma. When I returned from the airport to the central railway station, I noticed a few guys who seemed shady. The pushed their way between me and my wife on the escalator up to the street and when I got to the top the guy in front of me bent over as though he had dropped something to block my way. The two guys behind me were about to press up against me to pick my pockets, no doubt. I immediately realized what was going on so I dropped my shoulder and reverted back to the offensive lineman on my high school football team and I barrelled-over the guy who was attempting to block my way. I managed to hold onto my bags and I let out quite a few obcenities--in English--to the puzzled guys who feigned surprise. They got nothing. Interesting to note that two English girls sitting at an adjacent table at an outdoor cafe were approached by a nice young man and after he left one girl's wallet was gone. Be careful in Barcelona. Theft is rampant! You might want to consider having a decoy wallet: an old wallet filled with expired credit cards and a wad of worthless cash (e.g., 100,000 old Romanian lei or Bulgarian leva). If someone goes for your wallet they will get the decoy wallet and promptly walk away to examine their (worthless) booty. Ha, ha, ha, ha, ha.

HotelInfo.Name: H10 Raco Del Pi
HotelInfo.Address: C/ del Pi, 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
